\subsubsection*{Opening Sentence}
The hour is coming, and is now here, when the true worshipers will worship the Father in spirit and truth, for the Father is seeking such people to worship him.\\
\hfill --- JOHN 4:23

\subsubsection*{Confession of Sin}
\vspace{0.3em}\noindent\textit{The Officiant says to the People}\\[0.3em]
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}Let us humbly confess our sins to Almighty God.}\\

{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{Almighty and most merciful Father,}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{we have erred and strayed from your ways like lost sheep.}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{We have followed too much the devices and desires}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{of our own hearts.}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{We have offended against your holy laws.}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{We have left undone those things which we ought to have done,}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{and we have done those things which we ought not}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{to have done;}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{and apart from your grace, there is no health in us.}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{O Lord, have mercy upon us.}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{Spare all those who confess their faults.}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{Restore all those who are penitent, according to your promises}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{declared to all people in Christ Jesus our Lord.}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{And grant, O most merciful Father, for his sake,}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{that we may now live a godly, righteous, and sober life,}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{to the glory of your holy Name. Amen.}}\\
\vspace{0.3em}\noindent\textit{A Deacon or layperson remains kneeling and prays}\\[0.3em]
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}Grant to your faithful people, merciful Lord, pardon and peace; that we may be cleansed from all our sins, and serve you with a quiet mind; through Jesus Christ our Lord.}\\
\textbf{Amen.}\\

\subsection*{Preces}

\subsubsection*{The Preces}
\vspace{0.3em}\noindent\textit{All stand.}\\[0.3em]
\makebox[5em][l]{\textit{Officiant}}O Lord, open our lips;\\[0.5em]
\makebox[5em][l]{\textit{People}}\textbf{And our mouth shall proclaim your praise.}\\[0.5em]
\makebox[5em][l]{\textit{Officiant}}O God, make speed to save us;\\[0.5em]
\makebox[5em][l]{\textit{People}}\textbf{O Lord, make haste to help us.}\\[0.5em]
\makebox[5em][l]{\textit{Officiant}}Glory be to the Father, and to the Son, and to the Holy Spirit;\\[0.5em]
\makebox[5em][l]{\textit{People}}\textbf{As it was in the beginning, is now, and ever shall be, world without end. Amen.}\\[0.5em]
\makebox[5em][l]{\textit{Officiant}}Praise the Lord.\\[0.5em]
\makebox[5em][l]{\textit{People}}\textbf{The Lord’s Name be praised.}\\[0.5em]

\subsection*{Invitatory}

\subsubsection*{Venite}
\centerline{\textit{O Come}}
\vspace{0.3em}\noindent\textit{Officiant and People, all standing}\\[0.3em]
The mercy of the Lord is everlasting:\\
\textbf{O come, let us adore him.}\\

{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{O come, let us sing unto the Lord; *}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{let us heartily rejoice in the strength of our salvation.}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{Let us come before his presence with thanksgiving *}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{and show ourselves glad in him with psalms.}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{For the Lord is a great God *}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{and a great King above all gods.}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{In his hand are all the depths of the earth, *}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{and the heights of the hills are his also.}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{The sea is his, for he made it, *}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{and his hands prepared the dry land.}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{O come, let us worship and fall down, *}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{and kneel before the Lord our Maker.}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{For he is our God, *}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{and we are the people of his pasture,}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{and the sheep of his hand.}}\\
\vspace{0.3em}\noindent\textit{The following verses may be omitted.}\\[0.3em]
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{Today, if you will hear his voice, harden not your hearts *}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{as in the provocation, and as in the day of temptation in the wilderness,}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{When your fathers tested me, *}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{and put me to the proof, though they had seen my works.}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{Forty years long was I grieved with this generation and said, *}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{“It is a people that err in their hearts, for they have not known my ways,”}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{Of whom I swore in my wrath *}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{that they should not enter into my rest.}}\\
\hfill --- Psalm 95:1-7, 8-11
The mercy of the Lord is everlasting:\\
\textbf{O come, let us adore him.}\\

\subsection*{Psalms}

\subsubsection*{The Psalms Appointed}
\centerline{\textit{Sixty Day Cycle}}
\subsubsection*{Psalm 1}
\centerline{\textit{Beatus vir qui non abiit}}
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textsuperscript{1} Blessed is the man who has not walked in the counsel of the ungodly, *}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}nor stood in the way of sinners, and has not sat in the seat of the scornful;}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{\textsuperscript{2} But his delight is in the law of the LORD, *}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{and on his law will he meditate day and night.}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textsuperscript{3} And he shall be like a tree planted by the waterside, *}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}that will bring forth his fruit in due season.}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{\textsuperscript{4} His leaf also shall not wither; *}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{and look, whatever he does, it shall prosper.}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textsuperscript{5} As for the ungodly, it is not so with them; *}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}but they are like the chaff, which the wind scatters away from the face of the earth.}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{\textsuperscript{6} Therefore the ungodly shall not be able to stand in the judgment, *}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{neither the sinners in the congregation of the righteous.}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textsuperscript{7} For the LORD knows the way of the righteous, *}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}but the way of the ungodly shall perish.}\\
\subsubsection*{Psalm 15}
\centerline{\textit{Domine, quis habitabit?}}
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textsuperscript{1} LORD, who shall dwell in your tabernacle? *}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}Or who shall rest upon your holy hill?}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{\textsuperscript{2} Whoever leads an uncorrupt life, *}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{and does that which is right, and speaks the truth from his heart.}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textsuperscript{3} He has not spoken deceitfully with his tongue, nor done evil to his neighbor, *}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}and has not slandered his neighbor.}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{\textsuperscript{4} In his eyes the wicked is rejected, *}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{and he makes much of those who fear the LORD.}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textsuperscript{5} He swears to his neighbor and disappoints him not, *}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}though it were to his own hindrance.}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{\textsuperscript{6} He has not given his money for usury, *}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{nor taken a bribe against the innocent.}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textsuperscript{7} Whoever does these things *}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}shall never be overthrown.}\\

{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{Glory be to the Father, and to the Son, and to the Holy Spirit; *}}\\
\textbf{as it was in the beginning, is now, and ever shall be, world without end. Amen.}\\

\subsection*{First Reading}

\subsubsection*{The First Lesson}
\centerline{\textit{Hebrews 11:32-12:2}}
A reading from the Epistle to the Hebrews, beginning with the eleventh chapter, the thirty-second verse\\

\begin{quote}
\textsuperscript{32} And what more shall I say? For time would fail me to tell of Gideon, Barak, Samson, Jephthah, of David and Samuel and the prophets— \textsuperscript{33} who through faith conquered kingdoms, enforced justice, obtained promises, stopped the mouths of lions, \textsuperscript{34} quenched the power of fire, escaped the edge of the sword, were made strong out of weakness, became mighty in war, put foreign armies to flight. \textsuperscript{35} Women received back their dead by resurrection. Some were tortured, refusing to accept release, so that they might rise again to a better life. \textsuperscript{36} Others suffered mocking and flogging, and even chains and imprisonment. \textsuperscript{37} They were stoned, they were sawn in two, they were killed with the sword. They went about in skins of sheep and goats, destitute, afflicted, mistreated— \textsuperscript{38} of whom the world was not worthy—wandering about in deserts and mountains, and in dens and caves of the earth. \textsuperscript{39} And all these, though commended through their faith, did not receive what was promised, \textsuperscript{40} since God had provided something better for us, that apart from us they should not be made perfect. \textsuperscript{12} Therefore, since we are surrounded by so great a cloud of witnesses, let us also lay aside every weight, and sin which clings so closely, and let us run with endurance the race that is set before us, \textsuperscript{2} looking to Jesus, the founder and perfecter of our faith, who for the joy that was set before him endured the cross, despising the shame, and is seated at the right hand of the throne of God.
\end{quote}

The Word of the Lord.\\
\textbf{Thanks be to God.}\\

\subsection*{First Canticle}

\subsubsection*{TE DEUM LAUDAMUS}
\centerline{\textit{We Praise You, O God}}
\vspace{0.3em}\noindent\textit{The following Canticle is sung or said, all standing}\\[0.3em]
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{We praise you, O God; we acclaim you as Lord; *}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{all creation worships you, the Father everlasting.}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{To you all angels, all the powers of heaven, *}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{the cherubim and seraphim, sing in endless praise:}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{Holy, Holy, Holy, Lord God of power and might, *}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{heaven and earth are full of your glory.}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{The glorious company of apostles praise you. *}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{The noble fellowship of prophets praise you.}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{The white-robed army of martyrs praise you. *}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{Throughout the world the holy Church acclaims you:}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{Father, of majesty unbounded,}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{your true and only Son, worthy of all praise, *}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{and the Holy Spirit, advocate and guide.}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{You, Christ, are the king of glory, *}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{the eternal Son of the Father.}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{When you took our flesh to set us free *}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{you humbly chose the Virgin’s womb.}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{You overcame the sting of death *}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{and opened the kingdom of heaven to all believers.}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{You are seated at God’s right hand in glory. *}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{We believe that you will come to be our judge.}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{Come then, Lord, and help your people, *}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{bought with the price of your own blood,}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{and bring us with your saints *}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{to glory everlasting.}}\\
\vspace{0.3em}\noindent\textit{The following verses may be omitted}\\[0.3em]
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{Save your people, Lord, and bless your inheritance;*}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{govern and uphold them now and always.}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{Day by day we bless you; *}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{we praise your Name for ever.}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{Keep us today, Lord, from all sin; *}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{have mercy on us, Lord, have mercy.}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{Lord, show us your love and mercy, *}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{for we have put our trust in you.}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{In you, Lord, is our hope; *}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{let us never be put to shame.}}\\

\subsection*{Second Reading}

\subsubsection*{The Second Lesson}
\centerline{\textit{Acts 8:26-40}}
A reading from the Acts of the Apostles, beginning with the eighth chapter, the twenty-sixth verse\\

\begin{quote}
\textsuperscript{26} Now an angel of the Lord said to Philip, “Rise and go toward the south to the road that goes down from Jerusalem to Gaza. ” This is a desert place. \textsuperscript{27} And he rose and went. And there was an Ethiopian, a eunuch, a court official of Candace, queen of the Ethiopians, who was in charge of all her treasure. He had come to Jerusalem to worship \textsuperscript{28} and was returning, seated in his chariot, and he was reading the prophet Isaiah. \textsuperscript{29} And the Spirit said to Philip, “Go over and join this chariot. ” \textsuperscript{30} So Philip ran to him and heard him reading Isaiah the prophet and asked, “Do you understand what you are reading? ” \textsuperscript{31} And he said, “How can I, unless someone guides me? ” And he invited Philip to come up and sit with him. \textsuperscript{32} Now the passage of the Scripture that he was reading was this: “Like a sheep he was led to the slaughter and like a lamb before its shearer is silent, so he opens not his mouth. \textsuperscript{33} In his humiliation justice was denied him. Who can describe his generation? For his life is taken away from the earth. ” \textsuperscript{34} And the eunuch said to Philip, “About whom, I ask you, does the prophet say this, about himself or about someone else? ” \textsuperscript{35} Then Philip opened his mouth, and beginning with this Scripture he told him the good news about Jesus. \textsuperscript{36} And as they were going along the road they came to some water, and the eunuch said, “See, here is water! What prevents me from being baptized? ” \textsuperscript{38} And he commanded the chariot to stop, and they both went down into the water, Philip and the eunuch, and he baptized him. \textsuperscript{39} And when they came up out of the water, the Spirit of the Lord carried Philip away, and the eunuch saw him no more, and went on his way rejoicing. \textsuperscript{40} But Philip found himself at Azotus, and as he passed through he preached the gospel to all the towns until he came to Caesarea.
\end{quote}

The Word of the Lord.\\
\textbf{Thanks be to God.}\\

\subsection*{Second Canticle}

\subsubsection*{BENEDICTUS}
\centerline{\textit{The Song of Zechariah}}
\vspace{0.3em}\noindent\textit{The following Canticle is sung or said, all standing}\\[0.3em]
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{Blessed be the Lord, the God of Israel; *}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{he has come to his people and set them free.}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{He has raised up for us a mighty savior, *}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{born of the house of his servant David.}}\\

{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{that he would save us from our enemies, *}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{from the hands of all who hate us.}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{He promised to show mercy to our fathers *}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{and to remember his holy covenant.}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{This was the oath he swore to our father Abraham, *}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{to set us free from the hands of our enemies,}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{Free to worship him without fear, *}}\\
\textbf{holy and righteous in his sight}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{all the days of our life.}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{You, my child, shall be called the prophet of the Most High, *}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{for you will go before the Lord to prepare his way,}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{To give his people knowledge of salvation *}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{by the forgiveness of their sins.}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{In the tender compassion of our God *}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{the dawn from on high shall break upon us,}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{To shine on those who dwell in darkness}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{and in the shadow of death, *}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{and to guide our feet into the way of peace.}}\\

{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{Glory be to the Father, and to the Son, and to the Holy Spirit; *}}\\
\textbf{as it was in the beginning, is now, and ever shall be, world without end. Amen.}\\

\subsection*{The Apostle's Creed}

\subsubsection*{The Apostles' Creed}

\subsection*{Collect(s) of the Day}

\subsubsection*{Collect of the Day}
\centerline{\textit{All Saints' Day}}
Almighty God, you have knit together your elect in one communion and fellowship in the mystical Body of your Son: Give us grace so to follow your blessed saints in all virtuous and godly living, that we may come to those ineffable joys that you have prepared for those who truly love you; through Jesus Christ our Lord, who with you and the Holy Spirit lives and reigns, one God, in glory everlasting.\\
\textbf{Amen.}\\
\subsubsection*{Collect of the Day}
\centerline{\textit{Saturday after the Twentieth Sunday after Pentecost, or the Nineteenth Sunday after Trinity (Proper 25)}}
Almighty and everlasting God, you govern all things both in heaven and on earth: Mercifully hear the supplications of your people, and in our time grant us your peace; through Jesus Christ our Lord, who lives and reigns with you and the Holy Spirit, one God, for ever and ever.\\
\textbf{Amen.}\\

\subsection*{Additional Collects}

\subsubsection*{A Collect for Sabbath Rest}
\centerline{\textit{Saturday}}
Almighty God, who after the creation of the world rested from all your works and sanctified a day of rest for all your creatures: Grant that we, putting away all earthly anxieties, may be duly prepared for the service of your sanctuary, and that our rest here upon earth may be a preparation for the eternal rest promised to your people in heaven; through Jesus Christ our Lord.\\
\textbf{Amen.}\\
\subsubsection*{A Prayer for Mission}
O God, you have made of one blood all the peoples of the earth, and sent your blessed Son to preach peace to those who are far off and to those who are near: Grant that people everywhere may seek after you and find you; bring the nations into your fold; pour out your Spirit upon all flesh; and hasten the coming of your kingdom; through Jesus Christ our Lord.\\
\textbf{Amen.}\\

And he commanded the priests, the sons of Aaron, to offer them on the altar of the Lord . \textsuperscript{22} So they slaughtered the bulls, and the priests received the blood and threw it against the altar. And they slaughtered the rams, and their blood was thrown against the altar. And they slaughtered the lambs, and their blood was thrown against the altar. \textsuperscript{23} Then the goats for the sin offering were brought to the king and the assembly, and they laid their hands on them, \textsuperscript{24} and the priests slaughtered them and made a sin offering with their blood on the altar, to make atonement for all Israel. For the king commanded that the burnt offering and the sin offering should be made for all Israel. \textsuperscript{25} And he stationed the Levites in the house of the Lord with cymbals, harps, and lyres, according to the commandment of David and of Gad the king's seer and of Nathan the prophet, for the commandment was from the Lord through his prophets. \textsuperscript{26} The Levites stood with the instruments of David, and the priests with the trumpets. \textsuperscript{27} Then Hezekiah commanded that the burnt offering be offered on the altar. And when the burnt offering began, the song to the Lord began also, and the trumpets, accompanied by the instruments of David king of Israel. \textsuperscript{28} The whole assembly worshiped, and the singers sang, and the trumpeters sounded. All this continued until the burnt offering was finished. \textsuperscript{29} When the offering was finished, the king and all who were present with him bowed themselves and worshiped. \textsuperscript{30} And Hezekiah the king and the officials commanded the Levites to sing praises to the Lord with the words of David and of Asaph the seer. And they sang praises with gladness, and they bowed down and worshiped. \textsuperscript{31} Then Hezekiah said, “You have now consecrated yourselves to the Lord . Come near; bring sacrifices and thank offerings to the house of the Lord . ” And the assembly brought sacrifices and thank offerings, and all who were of a willing heart brought burnt offerings. \textsuperscript{32} The number of the burnt offerings that the assembly brought was \textsuperscript{70} bulls, \textsuperscript{100} rams, and \textsuperscript{200} lambs; all these were for a burnt offering to the Lord . \textsuperscript{33} And the consecrated offerings were \textsuperscript{600} bulls and 3,\textsuperscript{000} sheep. \textsuperscript{34} But the priests were too few and could not flay all the burnt offerings, so until other priests had consecrated themselves, their brothers the Levites helped them, until the work was finished—for the Levites were more upright in heart than the priests in consecrating themselves. \textsuperscript{35} Besides the great number of burnt offerings, there was the fat of the peace offerings, and there were the drink offerings for the burnt offerings. Thus the service of the house of the Lord was restored. \textsuperscript{36} And Hezekiah and all the people rejoiced because God had provided for the people, for the thing came about suddenly.
\end{quote}

The Word of the Lord.\\
\textbf{Thanks be to God.}\\

\subsection*{Collect(s) of the Day}

\subsubsection*{Collect of the Day}
\centerline{\textit{The Twenty-first Sunday after Pentecost, or the Twentieth Sunday after Trinity (Proper 26)}}
Grant us, Lord, not to be anxious about earthly things, but to love things heavenly; and even now, as we live among things that are passing away, to hold fast to those that shall endure; through Jesus Christ our Lord, who lives and reigns with you and the Holy Spirit, one God, for ever and ever.\\
\textbf{Amen.}\\
\subsubsection*{Collect of the Day}
\centerline{\textit{All Saints' Sunday}}
Almighty God, you have knit together your elect in one communion and fellowship in the mystical Body of your Son: Give us grace so to follow your blessed saints in all virtuous and godly living, that we may come to those ineffable joys that you have prepared for those who truly love you; through Jesus Christ our Lord, who with you and the Holy Spirit lives and reigns, one God, in glory everlasting.\\
\textbf{Amen.}\\
\subsubsection*{Collect of the Day}
\centerline{\textit{Commemoration of the Faithful Departed}}
Almighty God, by your Holy Spirit you have made us one with your saints in heaven and on earth: Grant that in our earthly pilgrimage we may always be supported by this fellowship of love and prayer, and know ourselves to be surrounded by their witness to your power and mercy; for the sake of Jesus Christ, in whom all our intercessions are acceptable through the Spirit, and who lives and reigns with you and the same Spirit, one God, for ever and ever.\\
\textbf{Amen.}\\

\subsection*{Additional Collects}

\subsubsection*{A Collect for Strength to Await Christ's Return}
\centerline{\textit{Sunday}}
O God our King, by the resurrection of your Son Jesus Christ on the first day of the week, you conquered sin, put death to flight, and gave us the hope of everlasting life: Redeem all our days by this victory; forgive our sins, banish our fears, make us bold to praise you and to do your will; and steel us to wait for the consummation of your kingdom on the last great Day; through Jesus Christ our Lord.\\
\textbf{Amen.}\\
\subsubsection*{A Prayer for Mission}
Almighty and everlasting God, who alone works great marvels: Send down upon our clergy and the congregations committed to their charge the life-giving Spirit of your grace, shower them with the continual dew of your blessing, and ignite in them a zealous love of your Gospel; through Jesus Christ our Lord.\\
\textbf{Amen.}\\

\begin{quote}
\textsuperscript{30} Hezekiah sent to all Israel and Judah, and wrote letters also to Ephraim and Manasseh, that they should come to the house of the Lord at Jerusalem to keep the Passover to the Lord , the God of Israel. \textsuperscript{2} For the king and his princes and all the assembly in Jerusalem had taken counsel to keep the Passover in the second month— \textsuperscript{3} for they could not keep it at that time because the priests had not consecrated themselves in sufficient number, nor had the people assembled in Jerusalem— \textsuperscript{4} and the plan seemed right to the king and all the assembly. \textsuperscript{5} So they decreed to make a proclamation throughout all Israel, from Beersheba to Dan, that the people should come and keep the Passover to the Lord , the God of Israel, at Jerusalem, for they had not kept it as often as prescribed. \textsuperscript{6} So couriers went throughout all Israel and Judah with letters from the king and his princes, as the king had commanded, saying, “O people of Israel, return to the Lord , the God of Abraham, Isaac, and Israel, that he may turn again to the remnant of you who have escaped from the hand of the kings of Assyria. \textsuperscript{7} Do not be like your fathers and your brothers, who were faithless to the Lord God of their fathers, so that he made them a desolation, as you see. \textsuperscript{8} Do not now be stiff-necked as your fathers were, but yield yourselves to the Lord and come to his sanctuary, which he has consecrated forever, and serve the Lord your God, that his fierce anger may turn away from you. \textsuperscript{9} For if you return to the Lord , your brothers and your children will find compassion with their captors and return to this land. For the Lord your God is gracious and merciful and will not turn away his face from you, if you return to him. ” \textsuperscript{10} So the couriers went from city to city through the country of Ephraim and Manasseh, and as far as Zebulun, but they laughed them to scorn and mocked them. \textsuperscript{11} However, some men of Asher, of Manasseh, and of Zebulun humbled themselves and came to Jerusalem. \textsuperscript{12} The hand of God was also on Judah to give them one heart to do what the king and the princes commanded by the word of the Lord . \textsuperscript{13} And many people came together in Jerusalem to keep the Feast of Unleavened Bread in the second month, a very great assembly. \textsuperscript{14} They set to work and removed the altars that were in Jerusalem, and all the altars for burning incense they took away and threw into the brook Kidron. \textsuperscript{15} And they slaughtered the Passover lamb on the fourteenth day of the second month. And the priests and the Levites were ashamed, so that they consecrated themselves and brought burnt offerings into the house of the Lord . \textsuperscript{16} They took their accustomed posts according to the Law of Moses the man of God. The priests threw the blood that they received from the hand of the Levites. \textsuperscript{17} For there were many in the assembly who had not consecrated themselves. Therefore the Levites had to slaughter the Passover lamb for everyone who was not clean, to consecrate it to the Lord . \textsuperscript{18} For a majority of the people, many of them from Ephraim, Manasseh, Issachar, and Zebulun, had not cleansed themselves, yet they ate the Passover otherwise than as prescribed. For Hezekiah had prayed for them, saying, “May the good Lord pardon everyone \textsuperscript{19} who sets his heart to seek God, the Lord , the God of his fathers, even though not according to the sanctuary's rules of cleanness. ” \textsuperscript{20} And the Lord heard Hezekiah and healed the people. \textsuperscript{21} And the people of Israel who were present at Jerusalem kept the Feast of Unleavened Bread seven days with great gladness, and the Levites and the priests praised the Lord day by day, singing with all their might to the Lord . \textsuperscript{22} And Hezekiah spoke encouragingly to all the Levites who showed good skill in the service of the Lord . So they ate the food of the festival for seven days, sacrificing peace offerings and giving thanks to the Lord , the God of their fathers. \textsuperscript{23} Then the whole assembly agreed together to keep the feast for another seven days. So they kept it for another seven days with gladness. \textsuperscript{24} For Hezekiah king of Judah gave the assembly 1,\textsuperscript{000} bulls and 7,\textsuperscript{000} sheep for offerings, and the princes gave the assembly 1,\textsuperscript{000} bulls and 10,\textsuperscript{000} sheep. And the priests consecrated themselves in great numbers. \textsuperscript{25} The whole assembly of Judah, and the priests and the Levites, and the whole assembly that came out of Israel, and the sojourners who came out of the land of Israel, and the sojourners who lived in Judah, rejoiced. \textsuperscript{26} So there was great joy in Jerusalem, for since the time of Solomon the son of David king of Israel there had been nothing like this in Jerusalem. \textsuperscript{27} Then the priests and the Levites arose and blessed the people, and their voice was heard, and their prayer came to his holy habitation in heaven.

\subsection*{Collect(s) of the Day}

\subsubsection*{Collect of the Day}
\centerline{\textit{Monday after the Twenty-first Sunday after Pentecost, or the Twentieth Sunday after Trinity (Proper 26)}}
Grant us, Lord, not to be anxious about earthly things, but to love things heavenly; and even now, as we live among things that are passing away, to hold fast to those that shall endure; through Jesus Christ our Lord, who lives and reigns with you and the Holy Spirit, one God, for ever and ever.\\
\textbf{Amen.}\\
\subsubsection*{Collect of the Day}
\centerline{\textit{Richard Hooker, Priest and Teacher of the Faith, 1600}}
Almighty God, you gave your servant Richard Hooker special gifts of grace to understand and teach the truth revealed in Christ Jesus: Grant that by this teaching we may know you, the one true God, and Jesus Christ whom you have sent; who lives and reigns with you and the Holy Spirit, one God, for ever and ever.\\
\textbf{Amen.}\\

\subsection*{Additional Collects}

\subsubsection*{A Collect for the Renewal of Life}
\centerline{\textit{Monday}}
O God, the King eternal, whose light divides the day from the night and turns the shadow of death into the morning: Drive far from us all wrong desires, incline our hearts to keep your law, and guide our feet into the way of peace; that, having done your will with cheerfulness during the day, we may, when night comes, rejoice to give you thanks; through Jesus Christ our Lord.\\
\textbf{Amen.}\\
\subsubsection*{A Prayer for Mission}
Lord Jesus Christ, you stretched out your arms of love on the hard wood of the Cross that everyone might come within the reach of your saving embrace: So clothe us in your Spirit that we, reaching forth our hands in love, may bring those who do not know you to the knowledge and love of you; for the honor of your Name.\\
\textbf{Amen.}\\

\centerline{\textit{II Kings 18}}
A reading from the Second Book of Kings, beginning with the eighteenth chapter, the first verse\\

\begin{quote}
\textsuperscript{18} In the third year of Hoshea son of Elah, king of Israel, Hezekiah the son of Ahaz, king of Judah, began to reign. \textsuperscript{2} He was twenty-five years old when he began to reign, and he reigned twenty-nine years in Jerusalem. His mother's name was Abi the daughter of Zechariah. \textsuperscript{3} And he did what was right in the eyes of the Lord , according to all that David his father had done. \textsuperscript{4} He removed the high places and broke the pillars and cut down the Asherah. And he broke in pieces the bronze serpent that Moses had made, for until those days the people of Israel had made offerings to it (it was called Nehushtan). \textsuperscript{5} He trusted in the Lord , the God of Israel, so that there was none like him among all the kings of Judah after him, nor among those who were before him. \textsuperscript{6} For he held fast to the Lord . He did not depart from following him, but kept the commandments that the Lord commanded Moses. \textsuperscript{7} And the Lord was with him; wherever he went out, he prospered. He rebelled against the king of Assyria and would not serve him. \textsuperscript{8} He struck down the Philistines as far as Gaza and its territory, from watchtower to fortified city. \textsuperscript{9} In the fourth year of King Hezekiah, which was the seventh year of Hoshea son of Elah, king of Israel, Shalmaneser king of Assyria came up against Samaria and besieged it, \textsuperscript{10} and at the end of three years he took it. In the sixth year of Hezekiah, which was the ninth year of Hoshea king of Israel, Samaria was taken. \textsuperscript{11} The king of Assyria carried the Israelites away to Assyria and put them in Halah, and on the Habor, the river of Gozan, and in the cities of the Medes, \textsuperscript{12} because they did not obey the voice of the Lord their God but transgressed his covenant, even all that Moses the servant of the Lord commanded. They neither listened nor obeyed. \textsuperscript{13} In the fourteenth year of King Hezekiah, Sennacherib king of Assyria came up against all the fortified cities of Judah and took them. \textsuperscript{14} And Hezekiah king of Judah sent to the king of Assyria at Lachish, saying, “I have done wrong; withdraw from me. Whatever you impose on me I will bear. ” And the king of Assyria required of Hezekiah king of Judah three hundred talents of silver and thirty talents of gold. \textsuperscript{15} And Hezekiah gave him all the silver that was found in the house of the Lord and in the treasuries of the king's house. \textsuperscript{16} At that time Hezekiah stripped the gold from the doors of the temple of the Lord and from the doorposts that Hezekiah king of Judah had overlaid and gave it to the king of Assyria. \textsuperscript{17} And the king of Assyria sent the Tartan, the Rab-saris, and the Rabshakeh with a great army from Lachish to King Hezekiah at Jerusalem. And they went up and came to Jerusalem. When they arrived, they came and stood by the conduit of the upper pool, which is on the highway to the Washer's Field. \textsuperscript{18} And when they called for the king, there came out to them Eliakim the son of Hilkiah, who was over the household, and Shebnah the secretary, and Joah the son of Asaph, the recorder. \textsuperscript{19} And the Rabshakeh said to them, “Say to Hezekiah, ‘Thus says the great king, the king of Assyria: On what do you rest this trust of yours? \textsuperscript{20} Do you think that mere words are strategy and power for war? In whom do you now trust, that you have rebelled against me? \textsuperscript{21} Behold, you are trusting now in Egypt, that broken reed of a staff, which will pierce the hand of any man who leans on it. Such is Pharaoh king of Egypt to all who trust in him. \textsuperscript{22} But if you say to me, “We trust in the Lord our God,” is it not he whose high places and altars Hezekiah has removed, saying to Judah and to Jerusalem, “You shall worship before this altar in Jerusalem”? \textsuperscript{23} Come now, make a wager with my master the king of Assyria: I will give you two thousand horses, if you are able on your part to set riders on them. \textsuperscript{24} How then can you repulse a single captain among the least of my master's servants, when you trust in Egypt for chariots and for horsemen? \textsuperscript{25} Moreover, is it without the Lord that I have come up against this place to destroy it? The Lord said to me, “Go up against this land and destroy it. ”’” \textsuperscript{26} Then Eliakim the son of Hilkiah, and Shebnah, and Joah, said to the Rabshakeh, “Please speak to your servants in Aramaic, for we understand it. Do not speak to us in the language of Judah within the hearing of the people who are on the wall. ” \textsuperscript{27} But the Rabshakeh said to them, “Has my master sent me to speak these words to your master and to you, and not to the men sitting on the wall, who are doomed with you to eat their own dung and to drink their own urine? ” \textsuperscript{28} Then the Rabshakeh stood and called out in a loud voice in the language of Judah: “Hear the word of the great king, the king of Assyria! \textsuperscript{29} Thus says the king: ‘Do not let Hezekiah deceive you, for he will not be able to deliver you out of my hand. \textsuperscript{30} Do not let Hezekiah make you trust in the Lord by saying, The Lord will surely deliver us, and this city will not be given into the hand of the king of Assyria. ’ \textsuperscript{31} Do not listen to Hezekiah, for thus says the king of Assyria: ‘Make your peace with me and come out to me. A reading from the Acts of the Apostles, beginning with the tenth chapter, the first verse\\

\begin{quote}
\textsuperscript{10} At Caesarea there was a man named Cornelius, a centurion of what was known as the Italian Cohort, \textsuperscript{2} a devout man who feared God with all his household, gave alms generously to the people, and prayed continually to God. \textsuperscript{3} About the ninth hour of the day he saw clearly in a vision an angel of God come in and say to him, “Cornelius. ” \textsuperscript{4} And he stared at him in terror and said, “What is it, Lord? ” And he said to him, “Your prayers and your alms have ascended as a memorial before God. \textsuperscript{5} And now send men to Joppa and bring one Simon who is called Peter. \textsuperscript{6} He is lodging with one Simon, a tanner, whose house is by the sea. ” \textsuperscript{7} When the angel who spoke to him had departed, he called two of his servants and a devout soldier from among those who attended him, \textsuperscript{8} and having related everything to them, he sent them to Joppa. \textsuperscript{9} The next day, as they were on their journey and approaching the city, Peter went up on the housetop about the sixth hour to pray. \textsuperscript{10} And he became hungry and wanted something to eat, but while they were preparing it, he fell into a trance \textsuperscript{11} and saw the heavens opened and something like a great sheet descending, being let down by its four corners upon the earth. \textsuperscript{12} In it were all kinds of animals and reptiles and birds of the air. \textsuperscript{13} And there came a voice to him: “Rise, Peter; kill and eat. ” \textsuperscript{14} But Peter said, “By no means, Lord; for I have never eaten anything that is common or unclean. ” \textsuperscript{15} And the voice came to him again a second time, “What God has made clean, do not call common. ” \textsuperscript{16} This happened three times, and the thing was taken up at once to heaven. \textsuperscript{17} Now while Peter was inwardly perplexed as to what the vision that he had seen might mean, behold, the men who were sent by Cornelius, having made inquiry for Simon's house, stood at the gate \textsuperscript{18} and called out to ask whether Simon who was called Peter was lodging there. \textsuperscript{19} And while Peter was pondering the vision, the Spirit said to him, “Behold, three men are looking for you. \textsuperscript{20} Rise and go down and accompany them without hesitation, for I have sent them. ” \textsuperscript{21} And Peter went down to the men and said, “I am the one you are looking for. What is the reason for your coming? ” \textsuperscript{22} And they said, “Cornelius, a centurion, an upright and God-fearing man, who is well spoken of by the whole Jewish nation, was directed by a holy angel to send for you to come to his house and to hear what you have to say. ” \textsuperscript{23} So he invited them in to be his guests. The next day he rose and went away with them, and some of the brothers from Joppa accompanied him.
\end{quote}

\subsection*{Collect(s) of the Day}

\subsubsection*{Collect of the Day}
\centerline{\textit{Tuesday after the Twenty-first Sunday after Pentecost, or the Twentieth Sunday after Trinity (Proper 26)}}
Grant us, Lord, not to be anxious about earthly things, but to love things heavenly; and even now, as we live among things that are passing away, to hold fast to those that shall endure; through Jesus Christ our Lord, who lives and reigns with you and the Holy Spirit, one God, for ever and ever.\\
\textbf{Amen.}\\

\subsection*{Additional Collects}

\subsubsection*{A Collect for Peace}
\centerline{\textit{Tuesday}}
O God, the author of peace and lover of concord, to know you is eternal life and to serve you is perfect freedom: Defend us, your humble servants, in all assaults of our enemies; that we, surely trusting in your defense, may not fear the power of any adversaries, through the might of Jesus Christ our Lord.\\
\textbf{Amen.}\\
\subsubsection*{A Prayer for Mission}
O God, you have made of one blood all the peoples of the earth, and sent your blessed Son to preach peace to those who are far off and to those who are near: Grant that people everywhere may seek after you and find you; bring the nations into your fold; pour out your Spirit upon all flesh; and hasten the coming of your kingdom; through Jesus Christ our Lord.\\
\textbf{Amen.}\\

\subsection*{First Reading}

\centerline{\textit{II Kings 19}}
A reading from the Second Book of Kings, beginning with the nineteenth chapter, the first verse\\

\begin{quote}
\textsuperscript{19} As soon as King Hezekiah heard it, he tore his clothes and covered himself with sackcloth and went into the house of the Lord . \textsuperscript{2} And he sent Eliakim, who was over the household, and Shebna the secretary, and the senior priests, covered with sackcloth, to the prophet Isaiah the son of Amoz. \textsuperscript{3} They said to him, “Thus says Hezekiah, This day is a day of distress, of rebuke, and of disgrace; children have come to the point of birth, and there is no strength to bring them forth. \textsuperscript{4} It may be that the Lord your God heard all the words of the Rabshakeh, whom his master the king of Assyria has sent to mock the living God, and will rebuke the words that the Lord your God has heard; therefore lift up your prayer for the remnant that is left. ” \textsuperscript{5} When the servants of King Hezekiah came to Isaiah, \textsuperscript{6} Isaiah said to them, “Say to your master, ‘Thus says the Lord : Do not be afraid because of the words that you have heard, with which the servants of the king of Assyria have reviled me. \textsuperscript{7} Behold, I will put a spirit in him, so that he shall hear a rumor and return to his own land, and I will make him fall by the sword in his own land. ’” \textsuperscript{8} The Rabshakeh returned, and found the king of Assyria fighting against Libnah, for he heard that the king had left Lachish. \textsuperscript{9} Now the king heard concerning Tirhakah king of Cush, “Behold, he has set out to fight against you. ” So he sent messengers again to Hezekiah, saying, \textsuperscript{10} “Thus shall you speak to Hezekiah king of Judah: ‘Do not let your God in whom you trust deceive you by promising that Jerusalem will not be given into the hand of the king of Assyria. \textsuperscript{11} Behold, you have heard what the kings of Assyria have done to all lands, devoting them to destruction. And shall you be delivered? \textsuperscript{12} Have the gods of the nations delivered them, the nations that my fathers destroyed, Gozan, Haran, Rezeph, and the people of Eden who were in Telassar? \textsuperscript{13} Where is the king of Hamath, the king of Arpad, the king of the city of Sepharvaim, the king of Hena, or the king of Ivvah? ’” \textsuperscript{14} Hezekiah received the letter from the hand of the messengers and read it; and Hezekiah went up to the house of the Lord and spread it before the Lord . \textsuperscript{15} And Hezekiah prayed before the Lord and said: “O Lord , the God of Israel, enthroned above the cherubim, you are the God, you alone, of all the kingdoms of the earth; you have made heaven and earth. \textsuperscript{16} Incline your ear, O Lord , and hear; open your eyes, O Lord , and see; and hear the words of Sennacherib, which he has sent to mock the living God. \textsuperscript{17} Truly, O Lord , the kings of Assyria have laid waste the nations and their lands \textsuperscript{18} and have cast their gods into the fire, for they were not gods, but the work of men's hands, wood and stone. Therefore they were destroyed. \textsuperscript{19} So now, O Lord our God, save us, please, from his hand, that all the kingdoms of the earth may know that you, O Lord , are God alone. ” \textsuperscript{20} Then Isaiah the son of Amoz sent to Hezekiah, saying, “Thus says the Lord , the God of Israel: Your prayer to me about Sennacherib king of Assyria I have heard. \textsuperscript{21} This is the word that the Lord has spoken concerning him: “She despises you, she scorns you— the virgin daughter of Zion; she wags her head behind you— the daughter of Jerusalem. \textsuperscript{22} “Whom have you mocked and reviled? Against whom have you raised your voice and lifted your eyes to the heights? Against the Holy One of Israel! \textsuperscript{23} By your messengers you have mocked the Lord, and you have said, ‘With my many chariots I have gone up the heights of the mountains, to the far recesses of Lebanon; I felled its tallest cedars, its choicest cypresses; I entered its farthest lodging place, its most fruitful forest. \textsuperscript{24} I dug wells and drank foreign waters, and I dried up with the sole of my foot all the streams of Egypt. ’ \textsuperscript{25} “Have you not heard that I determined it long ago? I planned from days of old what now I bring to pass, that you should turn fortified cities into heaps of ruins, \textsuperscript{26} while their inhabitants, shorn of strength, are dismayed and confounded, and have become like plants of the field and like tender grass, like grass on the housetops, blighted before it is grown. \textsuperscript{27} “But I know your sitting down and your going out and coming in, and your raging against me. \textsuperscript{28} Because you have raged against me and your complacency has come into my ears, I will put my hook in your nose and my bit in your mouth, and I will turn you back on the way by which you came. \textsuperscript{29} “And this shall be the sign for you: this year eat what grows of itself, and in the second year what springs of the same. Then in the third year sow and reap and plant vineyards, and eat their fruit. \textsuperscript{30} And the surviving remnant of the house of Judah shall again take root downward and bear fruit upward. \textsuperscript{31} For out of Jerusalem shall go a remnant, and out of Mount Zion a band of survivors. The zeal of the Lord will do this. \textsuperscript{32} “Therefore thus says the Lord concerning the king of Assyria: He shall not come into this city or shoot an arrow there, or come before it with a shield or cast up a siege mound against it. \textsuperscript{33} By the way that he came, by the same he shall return, and he shall not come into this city, declares the Lord . \textsuperscript{34} For I will defend this city to save it, for my own sake and for the sake of my servant David. ” \textsuperscript{35} And that night the angel of the Lord went out and struck down 185,\textsuperscript{000} in the camp of the Assyrians. And when people arose early in the morning, behold, these were all dead bodies. \textsuperscript{36} Then Sennacherib king of Assyria departed and went home and lived at Nineveh. \textsuperscript{37} And as he was worshiping in the house of Nisroch his god, Adrammelech and Sharezer, his sons, struck him down with the sword and escaped into the land of Ararat. And Esarhaddon his son reigned in his place.
\end{quote}

The Word of the Lord.\\
\textbf{Thanks be to God.}\\

\begin{quote}
\textsuperscript{24} And on the following day they entered Caesarea. Cornelius was expecting them and had called together his relatives and close friends. \textsuperscript{25} When Peter entered, Cornelius met him and fell down at his feet and worshiped him. \textsuperscript{26} But Peter lifted him up, saying, “Stand up; I too am a man. ” \textsuperscript{27} And as he talked with him, he went in and found many persons gathered. \textsuperscript{28} And he said to them, “You yourselves know how unlawful it is for a Jew to associate with or to visit anyone of another nation, but God has shown me that I should not call any person common or unclean. \textsuperscript{29} So when I was sent for, I came without objection. I ask then why you sent for me. ” \textsuperscript{30} And Cornelius said, “Four days ago, about this hour, I was praying in my house at the ninth hour, and behold, a man stood before me in bright clothing \textsuperscript{31} and said, ‘Cornelius, your prayer has been heard and your alms have been remembered before God. \textsuperscript{32} Send therefore to Joppa and ask for Simon who is called Peter. He is lodging in the house of Simon, a tanner, by the sea. ’ \textsuperscript{33} So I sent for you at once, and you have been kind enough to come. Now therefore we are all here in the presence of God to hear all that you have been commanded by the Lord. ” \textsuperscript{34} So Peter opened his mouth and said: “Truly I understand that God shows no partiality, \textsuperscript{35} but in every nation anyone who fears him and does what is right is acceptable to him. \textsuperscript{36} As for the word that he sent to Israel, preaching good news of peace through Jesus Christ (he is Lord of all), \textsuperscript{37} you yourselves know what happened throughout all Judea, beginning from Galilee after the baptism that John proclaimed: \textsuperscript{38} how God anointed Jesus of Nazareth with the Holy Spirit and with power. They put him to death by hanging him on a tree, \textsuperscript{40} but God raised him on the third day and made him to appear, \textsuperscript{41} not to all the people but to us who had been chosen by God as witnesses, who ate and drank with him after he rose from the dead. \textsuperscript{42} And he commanded us to preach to the people and to testify that he is the one appointed by God to be judge of the living and the dead. \textsuperscript{43} To him all the prophets bear witness that everyone who believes in him receives forgiveness of sins through his name. ” \textsuperscript{44} While Peter was still saying these things, the Holy Spirit fell on all who heard the word. \textsuperscript{45} And the believers from among the circumcised who had come with Peter were amazed, because the gift of the Holy Spirit was poured out even on the Gentiles. \textsuperscript{46} For they were hearing them speaking in tongues and extolling God. Then Peter declared, \textsuperscript{47} “Can anyone withhold water for baptizing these people, who have received the Holy Spirit just as we have? ” \textsuperscript{48} And he commanded them to be baptized in the name of Jesus Christ. \subsection*{Collect(s) of the Day}

\subsubsection*{Collect of the Day}
\centerline{\textit{Wednesday after the Twenty-first Sunday after Pentecost, or the Twentieth Sunday after Trinity (Proper 26)}}
Grant us, Lord, not to be anxious about earthly things, but to love things heavenly; and even now, as we live among things that are passing away, to hold fast to those that shall endure; through Jesus Christ our Lord, who lives and reigns with you and the Holy Spirit, one God, for ever and ever.\\
\textbf{Amen.}\\
\subsubsection*{Collect of the Day}
\centerline{\textit{Elizabeth and Zechariah, Parents of John the Baptist}}
Almighty God, by your Holy Spirit you have made us one with your saints in heaven and on earth: Grant that in our earthly pilgrimage we may always be supported by this fellowship of love and prayer, and know ourselves to be surrounded by their witness to your power and mercy; for the sake of Jesus Christ, in whom all our intercessions are acceptable through the Spirit, and who lives and reigns with you and the same Spirit, one God, for ever and ever.\\
\textbf{Amen.}\\

\subsection*{Additional Collects}

\subsubsection*{A Collect for Grace}
\centerline{\textit{Wednesday}}
O Lord, our heavenly Father, almighty and everlasting God, you have brought us safely to the beginning of this day: Defend us by your mighty power, that we may not fall into sin nor run into any danger; and that, guided by your Spirit, we may do what is righteous in your sight; through Jesus Christ our Lord.\\
\textbf{Amen.}\\
\subsubsection*{A Prayer for Mission}
Almighty and everlasting God, who alone works great marvels: Send down upon our clergy and the congregations committed to their charge the life-giving Spirit of your grace, shower them with the continual dew of your blessing, and ignite in them a zealous love of your Gospel; through Jesus Christ our Lord.\\
\textbf{Amen.}\\

\subsubsection*{A Prayer of St. John Chrysostom}
Almighty God, you have given us grace at this time, with one accord to make our common supplications to you; and you have promised through your well-beloved Son that when two or three are gathered together in his Name you will grant their requests: Fulfill now, O Lord, our desires and petitions as may be best for us; granting us in this world knowledge of your truth, and in the age to come life everlasting.\\
\textbf{Amen.}\\

\subsection*{Collect(s) of the Day}

\subsubsection*{Collect of the Day}
\centerline{\textit{Thursday after the Twenty-first Sunday after Pentecost, or the Twentieth Sunday after Trinity (Proper 26)}}
Grant us, Lord, not to be anxious about earthly things, but to love things heavenly; and even now, as we live among things that are passing away, to hold fast to those that shall endure; through Jesus Christ our Lord, who lives and reigns with you and the Holy Spirit, one God, for ever and ever.\\
\textbf{Amen.}\\
\subsubsection*{Collect of the Day}
\centerline{\textit{William Temple, Archbishop of Canterbury and Teacher of the Faith, 1944}}
O God, our heavenly Father, you raised up your faithful servant William Temple to be Bishop and pastor in your Church and to feed your flock: Give abundantly to all pastors the gifts of your Holy Spirit, that they may minister in your household as true servants of Christ and stewards of your divine mysteries; through Jesus Christ our Lord, who lives and reigns with you and the Holy Spirit, one God, for ever and ever.\\
\textbf{Amen.}\\

\subsection*{Additional Collects}

\subsubsection*{A Collect for Guidance}
\centerline{\textit{Thursday}}
Heavenly Father, in you we live and move and have our being: We humbly pray you so to guide and govern us by your Holy Spirit, that in all the cares and occupations of our life we may not forget you, but may remember that we are ever walking in your sight; through Jesus Christ our Lord.\\
\textbf{Amen.}\\
\subsubsection*{A Prayer for Mission}
Lord Jesus Christ, you stretched out your arms of love on the hard wood of the Cross that everyone might come within the reach of your saving embrace: So clothe us in your Spirit that we, reaching forth our hands in love, may bring those who do not know you to the knowledge and love of you; for the honor of your Name.\\
\textbf{Amen.}\\

\vspace{0.3em}\noindent\textit{The Officiant says to the People}\\[0.3em]
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}Dearly beloved, the Scriptures teach us to acknowledge our many sins and offenses, not concealing them from our heavenly Father, but confessing them with humble and obedient hearts that we may obtain forgiveness by his infinite goodness and mercy. We ought at all times humbly to acknowledge our sins before Almighty God, but especially when we come together in his presence to give thanks for the great benefits we have received at his hands, to declare his most worthy praise, to hear his holy Word, and to ask, for ourselves and on behalf of others, those things which are necessary for our life and our salvation. Therefore, draw near with me to the throne of heavenly grace.}\\

{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{Almighty and most merciful Father,}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{we have erred and strayed from your ways like lost sheep.}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{We have followed too much the devices and desires}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{of our own hearts.}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{We have offended against your holy laws.}}\\

{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{to have done;}}\\

{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{O Lord, have mercy upon us.}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{Spare all those who confess their faults.}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{Restore all those who are penitent, according to your promises}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{declared to all people in Christ Jesus our Lord.}}\\

{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{to the glory of your holy Name. Amen.}}\\

\begin{quote}
\textsuperscript{33} Manasseh was twelve years old when he began to reign, and he reigned fifty-five years in Jerusalem. \textsuperscript{2} And he did what was evil in the sight of the Lord , according to the abominations of the nations whom the Lord drove out before the people of Israel. \textsuperscript{3} For he rebuilt the high places that his father Hezekiah had broken down, and he erected altars to the Baals, and made Asheroth, and worshiped all the host of heaven and served them. \textsuperscript{4} And he built altars in the house of the Lord , of which the Lord had said, “In Jerusalem shall my name be forever. ” \textsuperscript{5} And he built altars for all the host of heaven in the two courts of the house of the Lord . \textsuperscript{6} And he burned his sons as an offering in the Valley of the Son of Hinnom, and used fortune-telling and omens and sorcery, and dealt with mediums and with necromancers. He did much evil in the sight of the Lord , provoking him to anger. \textsuperscript{7} And the carved image of the idol that he had made he set in the house of God, of which God said to David and to Solomon his son, “In this house, and in Jerusalem, which I have chosen out of all the tribes of Israel, I will put my name forever, \textsuperscript{8} and I will no more remove the foot of Israel from the land that I appointed for your fathers, if only they will be careful to do all that I have commanded them, all the law, the statutes, and the rules given through Moses. ” \textsuperscript{9} Manasseh led Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem astray, to do more evil than the nations whom the Lord destroyed before the people of Israel. \textsuperscript{10} The Lord spoke to Manasseh and to his people, but they paid no attention. \textsuperscript{11} Therefore the Lord brought upon them the commanders of the army of the king of Assyria, who captured Manasseh with hooks and bound him with chains of bronze and brought him to Babylon. \textsuperscript{12} And when he was in distress, he entreated the favor of the Lord his God and humbled himself greatly before the God of his fathers. \textsuperscript{13} He prayed to him, and God was moved by his entreaty and heard his plea and brought him again to Jerusalem into his kingdom. Then Manasseh knew that the Lord was God. \textsuperscript{14} Afterward he built an outer wall for the city of David west of Gihon, in the valley, and for the entrance into the Fish Gate, and carried it around Ophel, and raised it to a very great height. \begin{quote}
\textsuperscript{19} Now those who were scattered because of the persecution that arose over Stephen traveled as far as Phoenicia and Cyprus and Antioch, speaking the word to no one except Jews. \textsuperscript{20} But there were some of them, men of Cyprus and Cyrene, who on coming to Antioch spoke to the Hellenists also, preaching the Lord Jesus. \textsuperscript{21} And the hand of the Lord was with them, and a great number who believed turned to the Lord. \textsuperscript{22} The report of this came to the ears of the church in Jerusalem, and they sent Barnabas to Antioch. \textsuperscript{23} When he came and saw the grace of God, he was glad, and he exhorted them all to remain faithful to the Lord with steadfast purpose, \textsuperscript{24} for he was a good man, full of the Holy Spirit and of faith. And a great many people were added to the Lord. \textsuperscript{25} So Barnabas went to Tarsus to look for Saul, \textsuperscript{26} and when he had found him, he brought him to Antioch. For a whole year they met with the church and taught a great many people. And in Antioch the disciples were first called Christians. \textsuperscript{27} Now in these days prophets came down from Jerusalem to Antioch. \textsuperscript{28} And one of them named Agabus stood up and foretold by the Spirit that there would be a great famine over all the world (this took place in the days of Claudius). \textsuperscript{29} So the disciples determined, every one according to his ability, to send relief to the brothers living in Judea. \textsuperscript{30} And they did so, sending it to the elders by the hand of Barnabas and Saul.

\subsection*{Collect(s) of the Day}

\subsubsection*{Collect of the Day}
\centerline{\textit{Friday after the Twenty-first Sunday after Pentecost, or the Twentieth Sunday after Trinity (Proper 26)}}
Grant us, Lord, not to be anxious about earthly things, but to love things heavenly; and even now, as we live among things that are passing away, to hold fast to those that shall endure; through Jesus Christ our Lord, who lives and reigns with you and the Holy Spirit, one God, for ever and ever.\\
\textbf{Amen.}\\
\subsubsection*{Collect of the Day}
\centerline{\textit{Willibrord, Archbishop of Utrecht and Missionary to Frisia, 739}}
Almighty and everlasting God, you called your servant Willibrord to preach the Gospel: Raise up in this and every land evangelists and heralds of your kingdom, that your Church may proclaim the unsearchable riches of our Savior Jesus Christ; who lives and reigns with you and the Holy Spirit, one God, now and for ever.\\
\textbf{Amen.}\\

\subsection*{Additional Collects}

\subsubsection*{A Collect for Endurance}
\centerline{\textit{Friday}}
Almighty God, whose most dear Son went not up to joy but first he suffered pain, and entered not into glory before he was crucified: Mercifully grant that we, walking in the way of the Cross, may find it none other than the way of life and peace; through Jesus Christ your Son our Lord.\\
\textbf{Amen.}\\
\subsubsection*{A Prayer for Mission}
O God, you have made of one blood all the peoples of the earth, and sent your blessed Son to preach peace to those who are far off and to those who are near: Grant that people everywhere may seek after you and find you; bring the nations into your fold; pour out your Spirit upon all flesh; and hasten the coming of your kingdom; through Jesus Christ our Lord.\\
\textbf{Amen.}\\

{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}they curl their lips, and shake their heads, saying,}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{\textsuperscript{8} “He trusted in God, that he would deliver him; *}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{let him deliver him, if he will have him.”}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textsuperscript{9} But you are he that took me out of my mother’s womb; *}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}you were my hope, when I was yet upon my mother’s breasts.}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{\textsuperscript{10} I have been cast upon you ever since I was born; *}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{you are my God, even from my mother’s womb.}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textsuperscript{11} O go not far from me, for trouble is near at hand, *}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}and there is none to help me.}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{\textsuperscript{12} Many oxen have come around me; *}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{fat bulls of Bashan close me in on every side.}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textsuperscript{13} They gape at me with their mouths, *}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}like a ravening and a roaring lion.}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{\textsuperscript{14} I am poured out like water, and all my bones are out of joint; *}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{my heart also in the midst of my body is like melting wax.}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textsuperscript{15} My strength is dried up like a potsherd, and my tongue cleaves to my gums, *}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}and you bring me into the dust of death.}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{\textsuperscript{16} For many dogs have come about me, *}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{and the council of the wicked lays siege against me.}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textsuperscript{17} They pierced my hands and my feet; I can count all my bones; *}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}they stand staring and looking upon me.}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{\textsuperscript{18} They part my garments among them, *}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{and casts lots for my clothing.}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textsuperscript{19} But be not far from me, O LORD. *}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}You are my succor; hasten to help me.}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{\textsuperscript{20} Deliver my soul from the sword, *}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{my life from the power of the dog.}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textsuperscript{21} Save me from the lion’s mouth, *}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}and my soul in misery from among the horns of wild oxen.}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{\textsuperscript{22} I will declare your Name to my brethren; *}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{in the midst of the congregation I will praise you.}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textsuperscript{23} O praise the LORD, you that fear him; *}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}magnify him, all you seed of Jacob, and fear him, all you seed of Israel.}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{\textsuperscript{24} For he has not despised nor abhorred the low estate of the poor; *}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{he has not hidden his face from him, but when he called unto him, he heard him.}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textsuperscript{25} My praise is of you in the great congregation; *}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}my vows will I perform in the sight of those who fear him.}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{\textsuperscript{26} The poor shall eat and be satisfied; *}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{those who seek after the LORD shall praise him; may your hearts live for ever.}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textsuperscript{27} All the ends of the world shall remember, and be turned unto the LORD, *}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}and all the families of the nations shall worship before him.}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{\textsuperscript{28} For the kingdom is the LORD’s, *}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{and he is the Governor among the peoples.}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textsuperscript{29} All those who sleep in the earth, how shall they worship him? *}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}All those who go down into the dust, how shall they kneel before him?}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{\textsuperscript{30} But my life shall be preserved in his sight, and my children shall worship him; *}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{they shall tell of the Lord to the generations to come;}}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textsuperscript{31} And to a people yet unborn shall they declare his righteousness, *}\\
{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}that he has brought it to pass.}\\

{\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{Glory be to the Father, and to the Son, and to the Holy Spirit; *}}\\
\textbf{as it was in the beginning, is now, and ever shall be, world without end. Amen.}\\

\subsection*{First Reading}

\subsubsection*{The First Lesson}
\centerline{\textit{II Kings 21}}
A reading from the Second Book of Kings, beginning with the twenty-first chapter, the first verse\\

\begin{quote}
\textsuperscript{21} Manasseh was twelve years old when he began to reign, and he reigned fifty-five years in Jerusalem. His mother's name was Hephzibah. \textsuperscript{2} And he did what was evil in the sight of the Lord , according to the despicable practices of the nations whom the Lord drove out before the people of Israel. \textsuperscript{3} For he rebuilt the high places that Hezekiah his father had destroyed, and he erected altars for Baal and made an Asherah, as Ahab king of Israel had done, and worshiped all the host of heaven and served them. \textsuperscript{4} And he built altars in the house of the Lord , of which the Lord had said, “In Jerusalem will I put my name. ” \textsuperscript{5} And he built altars for all the host of heaven in the two courts of the house of the Lord . \textsuperscript{6} And he burned his son as an offering and used fortune-telling and omens and dealt with mediums and with necromancers. He did much evil in the sight of the Lord , provoking him to anger. \textsuperscript{7} And the carved image of Asherah that he had made he set in the house of which the Lord said to David and to Solomon his son, “In this house, and in Jerusalem, which I have chosen out of all the tribes of Israel, I will put my name forever. \textsuperscript{8} And I will not cause the feet of Israel to wander anymore out of the land that I gave to their fathers, if only they will be careful to do according to all that I have commanded them, and according to all the Law that my servant Moses commanded them. ” \textsuperscript{9} But they did not listen, and Manasseh led them astray to do more evil than the nations had done whom the Lord destroyed before the people of Israel. \textsuperscript{10} And the Lord said by his servants the prophets, \textsuperscript{11} “Because Manasseh king of Judah has committed these abominations and has done things more evil than all that the Amorites did, who were before him, and has made Judah also to sin with his idols, \textsuperscript{12} therefore thus says the Lord , the God of Israel: Behold, I am bringing upon Jerusalem and Judah such disaster that the ears of everyone who hears of it will tingle. \textsuperscript{13} And I will stretch over Jerusalem the measuring line of Samaria, and the plumb line of the house of Ahab, and I will wipe Jerusalem as one wipes a dish, wiping it and turning it upside down. \textsuperscript{14} And I will forsake the remnant of my heritage and give them into the hand of their enemies, and they shall become a prey and a spoil to all their enemies, \textsuperscript{15} because they have done what is evil in my sight and have provoked me to anger, since the day their fathers came out of Egypt, even to this day. ” \textsuperscript{16} Moreover, Manasseh shed very much innocent blood, till he had filled Jerusalem from one end to another, besides the sin that he made Judah to sin so that they did what was evil in the sight of the Lord . \textsuperscript{17} Now the rest of the acts of Manasseh and all that he did, and the sin that he committed, are they not written in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Judah? \textsuperscript{18} And Manasseh slept with his fathers and was buried in the garden of his house, in the garden of Uzza, and Amon his son reigned in his place. \textsuperscript{19} Amon was twenty-two years old when he began to reign, and he reigned two years in Jerusalem. His mother's name was Meshullemeth the daughter of Haruz of Jotbah. \textsuperscript{20} And he did what was evil in the sight of the Lord , as Manasseh his father had done. \textsuperscript{21} He walked in all the way in which his father walked and served the idols that his father served and worshiped them. \textsuperscript{22} He abandoned the Lord , the God of his fathers, and did not walk in the way of the Lord . \textsuperscript{23} And the servants of Amon conspired against him and put the king to death in his house. \textsuperscript{24} But the people of the land struck down all those who had conspired against King Amon, and the people of the land made Josiah his son king in his place. \textsuperscript{25} Now the rest of the acts of Amon that he did, are they not written in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Judah? \textsuperscript{26} And he was buried in his tomb in the garden of Uzza, and Josiah his son reigned in his place.

The Word of the Lord.\\
