\centerline{\textit{Acts 12:1-24}}
A reading from the Acts of the Apostles, beginning with the twelfth chapter, the first verse\\

\begin{quote}
\textsuperscript{12} About that time Herod the king laid violent hands on some who belonged to the church. \textsuperscript{2} He killed James the brother of John with the sword, \textsuperscript{3} and when he saw that it pleased the Jews, he proceeded to arrest Peter also. This was during the days of Unleavened Bread. \textsuperscript{4} And when he had seized him, he put him in prison, delivering him over to four squads of soldiers to guard him, intending after the Passover to bring him out to the people. \textsuperscript{5} So Peter was kept in prison, but earnest prayer for him was made to God by the church. \textsuperscript{6} Now when Herod was about to bring him out, on that very night, Peter was sleeping between two soldiers, bound with two chains, and sentries before the door were guarding the prison. \textsuperscript{7} And behold, an angel of the Lord stood next to him, and a light shone in the cell. He struck Peter on the side and woke him, saying, “Get up quickly. ” And the chains fell off his hands. \textsuperscript{8} And the angel said to him, “Dress yourself and put on your sandals. ” And he did so. And he said to him, “Wrap your cloak around you and follow me. ” \textsuperscript{9} And he went out and followed him. He did not know that what was being done by the angel was real, but thought he was seeing a vision. \textsuperscript{10} When they had passed the first and the second guard, they came to the iron gate leading into the city. It opened for them of its own accord, and they went out and went along one street, and immediately the angel left him. \textsuperscript{11} When Peter came to himself, he said, “Now I am sure that the Lord has sent his angel and rescued me from the hand of Herod and from all that the Jewish people were expecting. ” \textsuperscript{12} When he realized this, he went to the house of Mary, the mother of John whose other name was Mark, where many were gathered together and were praying. \textsuperscript{13} And when he knocked at the door of the gateway, a servant girl named Rhoda came to answer. \textsuperscript{14} Recognizing Peter's voice, in her joy she did not open the gate but ran in and reported that Peter was standing at the gate. \textsuperscript{15} They said to her, “You are out of your mind. ” But she kept insisting that it was so, and they kept saying, “It is his angel! ” \textsuperscript{16} But Peter continued knocking, and when they opened, they saw him and were amazed. \textsuperscript{17} But motioning to them with his hand to be silent, he described to them how the Lord had brought him out of the prison. And he said, “Tell these things to James and to the brothers. ” Then he departed and went to another place. \textsuperscript{18} Now when day came, there was no little disturbance among the soldiers over what had become of Peter. \textsuperscript{19} And after Herod searched for him and did not find him, he examined the sentries and ordered that they should be put to death. Then he went down from Judea to Caesarea and spent time there. \textsuperscript{20} Now Herod was angry with the people of Tyre and Sidon, and they came to him with one accord, and having persuaded Blastus, the king's chamberlain, they asked for peace, because their country depended on the king's country for food. \textsuperscript{21} On an appointed day Herod put on his royal robes, took his seat upon the throne, and delivered an oration to them. \textsuperscript{22} And the people were shouting, “The voice of a god, and not of a man! ” \textsuperscript{23} Immediately an angel of the Lord struck him down, because he did not give God the glory, and he was eaten by worms and breathed his last. \textsuperscript{24} But the word of God increased and multiplied.
\end{quote}

The Word of the Lord.\\
\textbf{Thanks be to God.}\\

\subsection*{Collect(s) of the Day}

\subsubsection*{Collect of the Day}
\centerline{\textit{Saturday after the Twenty-first Sunday after Pentecost, or the Twentieth Sunday after Trinity (Proper 26)}}
Grant us, Lord, not to be anxious about earthly things, but to love things heavenly; and even now, as we live among things that are passing away, to hold fast to those that shall endure; through Jesus Christ our Lord, who lives and reigns with you and the Holy Spirit, one God, for ever and ever.\\
\textbf{Amen.}\\

\subsection*{Additional Collects}

\subsubsection*{A Collect for Sabbath Rest}
\centerline{\textit{Saturday}}
Almighty God, who after the creation of the world rested from all your works and sanctified a day of rest for all your creatures: Grant that we, putting away all earthly anxieties, may be duly prepared for the service of your sanctuary, and that our rest here upon earth may be a preparation for the eternal rest promised to your people in heaven; through Jesus Christ our Lord.\\
\textbf{Amen.}\\
\subsubsection*{A Prayer for Mission}
Almighty and everlasting God, who alone works great marvels: Send down upon our clergy and the congregations committed to their charge the life-giving Spirit of your grace, shower them with the continual dew of your blessing, and ignite in them a zealous love of your Gospel; through Jesus Christ our Lord.\\
\textbf{Amen.}\\

\subsection*{Collect(s) of the Day}

\subsubsection*{Collect of the Day}
\centerline{\textit{The Twenty-second Sunday after Pentecost, or the Twenty-first Sunday after Trinity (Proper 27)}}
O God, whose blessed Son came into the world that he might destroy the works of the devil and make us children of God and heirs of eternal life: Grant that, having this hope, we may purify ourselves as he is pure; that, when he comes again with power and great glory, we may be made like him in his eternal and glorious kingdom; where he lives and reigns with you and the Holy Spirit, one God, for ever and ever.\\
\textbf{Amen.}\\

\subsection*{Additional Collects}

\subsubsection*{A Collect for Strength to Await Christ's Return}
\centerline{\textit{Sunday}}
O God our King, by the resurrection of your Son Jesus Christ on the first day of the week, you conquered sin, put death to flight, and gave us the hope of everlasting life: Redeem all our days by this victory; forgive our sins, banish our fears, make us bold to praise you and to do your will; and steel us to wait for the consummation of your kingdom on the last great Day; through Jesus Christ our Lord.\\
\textbf{Amen.}\\
\subsubsection*{A Prayer for Mission}
Lord Jesus Christ, you stretched out your arms of love on the hard wood of the Cross that everyone might come within the reach of your saving embrace: So clothe us in your Spirit that we, reaching forth our hands in love, may bring those who do not know you to the knowledge and love of you; for the honor of your Name.\\
\textbf{Amen.}\\

And all the people joined in the covenant. \textsuperscript{4} And the king commanded Hilkiah the high priest and the priests of the second order and the keepers of the threshold to bring out of the temple of the Lord all the vessels made for Baal, for Asherah, and for all the host of heaven. He burned them outside Jerusalem in the fields of the Kidron and carried their ashes to Bethel. \textsuperscript{5} And he deposed the priests whom the kings of Judah had ordained to make offerings in the high places at the cities of Judah and around Jerusalem; those also who burned incense to Baal, to the sun and the moon and the constellations and all the host of the heavens. \textsuperscript{6} And he brought out the Asherah from the house of the Lord , outside Jerusalem, to the brook Kidron, and burned it at the brook Kidron and beat it to dust and cast the dust of it upon the graves of the common people. \textsuperscript{7} And he broke down the houses of the male cult prostitutes who were in the house of the Lord , where the women wove hangings for the Asherah. \textsuperscript{8} And he brought all the priests out of the cities of Judah, and defiled the high places where the priests had made offerings, from Geba to Beersheba. And he broke down the high places of the gates that were at the entrance of the gate of Joshua the governor of the city, which were on one's left at the gate of the city. \textsuperscript{9} However, the priests of the high places did not come up to the altar of the Lord in Jerusalem, but they ate unleavened bread among their brothers. \textsuperscript{10} And he defiled Topheth, which is in the Valley of the Son of Hinnom, that no one might burn his son or his daughter as an offering to Molech. \textsuperscript{11} And he removed the horses that the kings of Judah had dedicated to the sun, at the entrance to the house of the Lord , by the chamber of Nathan-melech the chamberlain, which was in the precincts. And he burned the chariots of the sun with fire. \textsuperscript{12} And the altars on the roof of the upper chamber of Ahaz, which the kings of Judah had made, and the altars that Manasseh had made in the two courts of the house of the Lord , he pulled down and broke in pieces and cast the dust of them into the brook Kidron. \textsuperscript{13} And the king defiled the high places that were east of Jerusalem, to the south of the mount of corruption, which Solomon the king of Israel had built for Ashtoreth the abomination of the Sidonians, and for Chemosh the abomination of Moab, and for Milcom the abomination of the Ammonites. \textsuperscript{14} And he broke in pieces the pillars and cut down the Asherim and filled their places with the bones of men. \textsuperscript{15} Moreover, the altar at Bethel, the high place erected by Jeroboam the son of Nebat, who made Israel to sin, that altar with the high place he pulled down and burned, reducing it to dust. He also burned the Asherah. \textsuperscript{16} And as Josiah turned, he saw the tombs there on the mount. And he sent and took the bones out of the tombs and burned them on the altar and defiled it, according to the word of the Lord that the man of God proclaimed, who had predicted these things. \textsuperscript{17} Then he said, “What is that monument that I see? ” And the men of the city told him, “It is the tomb of the man of God who came from Judah and predicted these things that you have done against the altar at Bethel. ” \textsuperscript{18} And he said, “Let him be; let no man move his bones. ” So they let his bones alone, with the bones of the prophet who came out of Samaria. \textsuperscript{19} And Josiah removed all the shrines also of the high places that were in the cities of Samaria, which kings of Israel had made, provoking the Lord to anger. He did to them according to all that he had done at Bethel. \textsuperscript{20} And he sacrificed all the priests of the high places who were there, on the altars, and burned human bones on them. Then he returned to Jerusalem. \textsuperscript{21} And the king commanded all the people, “Keep the Passover to the Lord your God, as it is written in this Book of the Covenant. ” \textsuperscript{22} For no such Passover had been kept since the days of the judges who judged Israel, or during all the days of the kings of Israel or of the kings of Judah. \textsuperscript{23} But in the eighteenth year of King Josiah this Passover was kept to the Lord in Jerusalem. \textsuperscript{24} Moreover, Josiah put away the mediums and the necromancers and the household gods and the idols and all the abominations that were seen in the land of Judah and in Jerusalem, that he might establish the words of the law that were written in the book that Hilkiah the priest found in the house of the Lord . \textsuperscript{25} Before him there was no king like him, who turned to the Lord with all his heart and with all his soul and with all his might, according to all the Law of Moses, nor did any like him arise after him. \textsuperscript{26} Still the Lord did not turn from the burning of his great wrath, by which his anger was kindled against Judah, because of all the provocations with which Manasseh had provoked him. \textsuperscript{27} And the Lord said, “I will remove Judah also out of my sight, as I have removed Israel, and I will cast off this city that I have chosen, Jerusalem, and the house of which I said, My name shall be there. ” \textsuperscript{28} Now the rest of the acts of Josiah and all that he did, are they not written in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Judah? \textsuperscript{29} In his days Pharaoh Neco king of Egypt went up to the king of Assyria to the river Euphrates. King Josiah went to meet him, and Pharaoh Neco killed him at Megiddo, as soon as he saw him. \textsuperscript{30} And his servants carried him dead in a chariot from Megiddo and brought him to Jerusalem and buried him in his own tomb. And the people of the land took Jehoahaz the son of Josiah, and anointed him, and made him king in his father's place. \textsuperscript{31} Jehoahaz was twenty-three years old when he began to reign, and he reigned three months in Jerusalem. His mother's name was Hamutal the daughter of Jeremiah of Libnah. \textsuperscript{32} And he did what was evil in the sight of the Lord , according to all that his fathers had done. \textsuperscript{33} And Pharaoh Neco put him in bonds at Riblah in the land of Hamath, that he might not reign in Jerusalem, and laid on the land a tribute of a hundred talents of silver and a talent of gold. \textsuperscript{34} And Pharaoh Neco made Eliakim the son of Josiah king in the place of Josiah his father, and changed his name to Jehoiakim. But he took Jehoahaz away, and he came to Egypt and died there. \textsuperscript{35} And Jehoiakim gave the silver and the gold to Pharaoh, but he taxed the land to give the money according to the command of Pharaoh. He exacted the silver and the gold of the people of the land, from everyone according to his assessment, to give it to Pharaoh Neco. \textsuperscript{36} Jehoiakim was twenty-five years old when he began to reign, and he reigned eleven years in Jerusalem. His mother's name was Zebidah the daughter of Pedaiah of Rumah. \textsuperscript{37} And he did what was evil in the sight of the Lord , according to all that his fathers had done.
\end{quote}

The Word of the Lord.\\
\textbf{Thanks be to God.}\\

\subsection*{Collect(s) of the Day}

\subsubsection*{Collect of the Day}
\centerline{\textit{Monday after the Twenty-second Sunday after Pentecost, or the Twenty-first Sunday after Trinity (Proper 27)}}
O God, whose blessed Son came into the world that he might destroy the works of the devil and make us children of God and heirs of eternal life: Grant that, having this hope, we may purify ourselves as he is pure; that, when he comes again with power and great glory, we may be made like him in his eternal and glorious kingdom; where he lives and reigns with you and the Holy Spirit, one God, for ever and ever.\\
\textbf{Amen.}\\
\subsubsection*{Collect of the Day}
\centerline{\textit{Leo the Great, Bishop of Rome and Teacher of the Faith, 461}}
O God, our heavenly Father, you raised up your faithful servant Leo the Great to be Bishop and pastor in your Church and to feed your flock: Give abundantly to all pastors the gifts of your Holy Spirit, that they may minister in your household as true servants of Christ and stewards of your divine mysteries; through Jesus Christ our Lord, who lives and reigns with you and the Holy Spirit, one God, for ever and ever.\\
\textbf{Amen.}\\

\subsection*{Additional Collects}

\subsubsection*{A Collect for the Renewal of Life}
\centerline{\textit{Monday}}
O God, the King eternal, whose light divides the day from the night and turns the shadow of death into the morning: Drive far from us all wrong desires, incline our hearts to keep your law, and guide our feet into the way of peace; that, having done your will with cheerfulness during the day, we may, when night comes, rejoice to give you thanks; through Jesus Christ our Lord.\\
\textbf{Amen.}\\
\subsubsection*{A Prayer for Mission}
O God, you have made of one blood all the peoples of the earth, and sent your blessed Son to preach peace to those who are far off and to those who are near: Grant that people everywhere may seek after you and find you; bring the nations into your fold; pour out your Spirit upon all flesh; and hasten the coming of your kingdom; through Jesus Christ our Lord.\\
\textbf{Amen.}\\

\subsubsection*{A Prayer of St. John Chrysostom}
Almighty God, you have given us grace at this time, with one accord to make our common supplications to you; and you have promised through your well-beloved Son that when two or three are gathered together in his Name you will grant their requests: Fulfill now, O Lord, our desires and petitions as may be best for us; granting us in this world knowledge of your truth, and in the age to come life everlasting.\\
\textbf{Amen.}\\

\subsection*{Collect(s) of the Day}

\subsubsection*{Collect of the Day}
\centerline{\textit{Remembrance Day (Canada)}}
O King and Judge of the nations: We remember before you with grateful hearts the men and women of our armed forces, who in the day of decision ventured much for the liberties we now enjoy; grant that we may not rest until all the people of this land share the benefits of true freedom and gladly accept its disciplines; through Jesus Christ our Lord, who with you and the Holy Spirit lives and reigns, now and for ever.\\
\textbf{Amen.}\\
\subsubsection*{Collect of the Day}
\centerline{\textit{Tuesday after the Twenty-second Sunday after Pentecost, or the Twenty-first Sunday after Trinity (Proper 27)}}
O God, whose blessed Son came into the world that he might destroy the works of the devil and make us children of God and heirs of eternal life: Grant that, having this hope, we may purify ourselves as he is pure; that, when he comes again with power and great glory, we may be made like him in his eternal and glorious kingdom; where he lives and reigns with you and the Holy Spirit, one God, for ever and ever.\\
\textbf{Amen.}\\
\subsubsection*{Collect of the Day}
\centerline{\textit{Martin, Bishop of Tours, 397}}
O God, our heavenly Father, you raised up your faithful servant Martin to be Bishop and pastor in your Church and to feed your flock: Give abundantly to all pastors the gifts of your Holy Spirit, that they may minister in your household as true servants of Christ and stewards of your divine mysteries; through Jesus Christ our Lord, who lives and reigns with you and the Holy Spirit, one God, for ever and ever.\\
\textbf{Amen.}\\

\subsection*{Additional Collects}

\subsubsection*{A Collect for Peace}
\centerline{\textit{Tuesday}}
O God, the author of peace and lover of concord, to know you is eternal life and to serve you is perfect freedom: Defend us, your humble servants, in all assaults of our enemies; that we, surely trusting in your defense, may not fear the power of any adversaries, through the might of Jesus Christ our Lord.\\
\textbf{Amen.}\\
\subsubsection*{A Prayer for Mission}
Almighty and everlasting God, who alone works great marvels: Send down upon our clergy and the congregations committed to their charge the life-giving Spirit of your grace, shower them with the continual dew of your blessing, and ignite in them a zealous love of your Gospel; through Jesus Christ our Lord.\\
\textbf{Amen.}\\

\begin{quote}

And they built siegeworks all around it. \textsuperscript{2} So the city was besieged till the eleventh year of King Zedekiah. \textsuperscript{3} On the ninth day of the fourth month the famine was so severe in the city that there was no food for the people of the land. \textsuperscript{4} Then a breach was made in the city, and all the men of war fled by night by the way of the gate between the two walls, by the king's garden, and the Chaldeans were around the city. What was of gold the captain of the guard took away as gold, and what was of silver, as silver. \textsuperscript{16} As for the two pillars, the one sea, and the stands that Solomon had made for the house of the Lord , the bronze of all these vessels was beyond weight. \textsuperscript{17} The height of the one pillar was eighteen cubits, and on it was a capital of bronze. And the second pillar had the same, with the latticework. \textsuperscript{18} And the captain of the guard took Seraiah the chief priest and Zephaniah the second priest and the three keepers of the threshold; \textsuperscript{19} and from the city he took an officer who had been in command of the men of war, and five men of the king's council who were found in the city; and the secretary of the commander of the army, who mustered the people of the land; and sixty men of the people of the land, who were found in the city. \textsuperscript{20} And Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard took them and brought them to the king of Babylon at Riblah. \textsuperscript{21} And the king of Babylon struck them down and put them to death at Riblah in the land of Hamath. So Judah was taken into exile out of its land. \textsuperscript{22} And over the people who remained in the land of Judah, whom Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon had left, he appointed Gedaliah the son of Ahikam, son of Shaphan, governor. \textsuperscript{23} Now when all the captains and their men heard that the king of Babylon had appointed Gedaliah governor, they came with their men to Gedaliah at Mizpah, namely, Ishmael the son of Nethaniah, and Johanan the son of Kareah, and Seraiah the son of Tanhumeth the Netophathite, and Jaazaniah the son of the Maacathite. \textsuperscript{24} And Gedaliah swore to them and their men, saying, “Do not be afraid because of the Chaldean officials. Live in the land and serve the king of Babylon, and it shall be well with you. ” \textsuperscript{25} But in the seventh month, Ishmael the son of Nethaniah, son of Elishama, of the royal family, came with ten men and struck down Gedaliah and put him to death along with the Jews and the Chaldeans who were with him at Mizpah. \textsuperscript{26} Then all the people, both small and great, and the captains of the forces arose and went to Egypt, for they were afraid of the Chaldeans. \textsuperscript{27} And in the thirty-seventh year of the exile of Jehoiachin king of Judah, in the twelfth month, on the twenty-seventh day of the month, Evil-merodach king of Babylon, in the year that he began to reign, graciously freed Jehoiachin king of Judah from prison. \textsuperscript{28} And he spoke kindly to him and gave him a seat above the seats of the kings who were with him in Babylon. \textsuperscript{29} So Jehoiachin put off his prison garments. And every day of his life he dined regularly at the king's table, \textsuperscript{30} and for his allowance, a regular allowance was given him by the king, according to his daily needs, as long as he lived.
\end{quote}

The Word of the Lord.\\
\textbf{Thanks be to God.}\\

We also are men, of like nature with you, and we bring you good news, that you should turn from these vain things to a living God, who made the heaven and the earth and the sea and all that is in them. \textsuperscript{16} In past generations he allowed all the nations to walk in their own ways. \textsuperscript{17} Yet he did not leave himself without witness, for he did good by giving you rains from heaven and fruitful seasons, satisfying your hearts with food and gladness. ” \textsuperscript{18} Even with these words they scarcely restrained the people from offering sacrifice to them. \textsuperscript{19} But Jews came from Antioch and Iconium, and having persuaded the crowds, they stoned Paul and dragged him out of the city, supposing that he was dead. \textsuperscript{20} But when the disciples gathered about him, he rose up and entered the city, and on the next day he went on with Barnabas to Derbe. \textsuperscript{21} When they had preached the gospel to that city and had made many disciples, they returned to Lystra and to Iconium and to Antioch, \textsuperscript{22} strengthening the souls of the disciples, encouraging them to continue in the faith, and saying that through many tribulations we must enter the kingdom of God. \textsuperscript{23} And when they had appointed elders for them in every church, with prayer and fasting they committed them to the Lord in whom they had believed. \textsuperscript{24} Then they passed through Pisidia and came to Pamphylia. \textsuperscript{25} And when they had spoken the word in Perga, they went down to Attalia, \textsuperscript{26} and from there they sailed to Antioch, where they had been commended to the grace of God for the work that they had fulfilled. \textsuperscript{27} And when they arrived and gathered the church together, they declared all that God had done with them, and how he had opened a door of faith to the Gentiles. \textsuperscript{28} And they remained no little time with the disciples.

\subsection*{Collect(s) of the Day}

\subsubsection*{Collect of the Day}
\centerline{\textit{Wednesday after the Twenty-second Sunday after Pentecost, or the Twenty-first Sunday after Trinity (Proper 27)}}
O God, whose blessed Son came into the world that he might destroy the works of the devil and make us children of God and heirs of eternal life: Grant that, having this hope, we may purify ourselves as he is pure; that, when he comes again with power and great glory, we may be made like him in his eternal and glorious kingdom; where he lives and reigns with you and the Holy Spirit, one God, for ever and ever.\\
\textbf{Amen.}\\

\subsection*{Additional Collects}

\subsubsection*{A Collect for Grace}
\centerline{\textit{Wednesday}}
O Lord, our heavenly Father, almighty and everlasting God, you have brought us safely to the beginning of this day: Defend us by your mighty power, that we may not fall into sin nor run into any danger; and that, guided by your Spirit, we may do what is righteous in your sight; through Jesus Christ our Lord.\\
\textbf{Amen.}\\
\subsubsection*{A Prayer for Mission}
Lord Jesus Christ, you stretched out your arms of love on the hard wood of the Cross that everyone might come within the reach of your saving embrace: So clothe us in your Spirit that we, reaching forth our hands in love, may bring those who do not know you to the knowledge and love of you; for the honor of your Name.\\
\textbf{Amen.}\\

\begin{quote}
\textsuperscript{4} When the Israelites living in Judea heard of everything that Holofernes, the general of Nebuchadnezzar, the king of the Assyrians, had done to the nations, and how he had plundered and destroyed all their temples, \textsuperscript{2} they were therefore greatly terrified at his approach; they were alarmed both for Jerusalem and for the temple of the Lord their God. \textsuperscript{3} For they had only recently returned from exile, and all the people of Judea had just now gathered together, and the sacred vessels and the altar and the temple had been consecrated after their profanation. \textsuperscript{4} So they sent word to every district of Samaria, and to Kona, Beth-horon, Belmain, and Jericho, and to Choba and Aesora, and the valley of Salem. \textsuperscript{5} They immediately seized all the high hilltops and fortified the villages on them and stored up food in preparation for war—since their fields had recently been harvested. \textsuperscript{6} The high priest, Joakim, who was in Jerusalem at the time, wrote to the people of Bethulia and Betomesthaim, which faces Esdraelon opposite the plain near Dothan, \textsuperscript{7} ordering them to seize the mountain passes, since by them Judea could be invaded; and it would be easy to stop any who tried to enter, for the approach was narrow, wide enough for only two at a time to pass. \textsuperscript{8} So the Israelites did as they had been ordered by the high priest Joakim and the senate of the whole people of Israel, in session at Jerusalem. \textsuperscript{9} And every man of Israel cried out to God with great fervor, and they humbled themselves with much fasting. \textsuperscript{10} They and their wives and their children and their cattle and every resident alien and hired laborer and purchased slave—they all put sackcloth around their waists. \textsuperscript{11} And all the Israelite men, women, and children living at Jerusalem prostrated themselves before the temple and put ashes on their heads and spread out their sackcloth before the Lord. \textsuperscript{12} They even draped the altar with sackcloth and cried out in unison, praying fervently to the God of Israel not to allow their infants to be carried off and their wives to be taken as booty, and the towns they had inherited to be destroyed, and the sanctuary to be profaned and desecrated to the malicious joy of the Gentiles. \textsuperscript{13} The Lord heard their prayers and had regard for their distress; for the people fasted many days throughout Judea and in Jerusalem before the sanctuary of the Lord Almighty. \textsuperscript{14} The high priest Joakim and all the priests who stood before the Lord and ministered to the Lord, with sackcloth around their loins, offered the daily burnt offerings, the votive offerings, and freewill offerings of the people. \textsuperscript{15} With ashes on their turbans, they cried out to the Lord with all their might to look with favor on the whole house of Israel.

\subsection*{Collect(s) of the Day}

\subsubsection*{Collect of the Day}
\centerline{\textit{Thursday after the Twenty-second Sunday after Pentecost, or the Twenty-first Sunday after Trinity (Proper 27)}}
O God, whose blessed Son came into the world that he might destroy the works of the devil and make us children of God and heirs of eternal life: Grant that, having this hope, we may purify ourselves as he is pure; that, when he comes again with power and great glory, we may be made like him in his eternal and glorious kingdom; where he lives and reigns with you and the Holy Spirit, one God, for ever and ever.\\
\textbf{Amen.}\\
\subsubsection*{Collect of the Day}
\centerline{\textit{Charles Simeon, Priest and Evangelist, 1836}}
Almighty God, we give you thanks for the ministry of Charles Simeon, who labored that the Church of Jesus Christ might be one: Grant that we, instructed by his teaching and example, and knit together in unity by your Spirit, may ever stand firm upon the one foundation, which is Jesus Christ our Lord; who lives and reigns with you, in the unity of the Holy Spirit, one God, now and for ever.\\
\textbf{Amen.}\\

\subsection*{Additional Collects}

\subsubsection*{A Collect for Guidance}
\centerline{\textit{Thursday}}
Heavenly Father, in you we live and move and have our being: We humbly pray you so to guide and govern us by your Holy Spirit, that in all the cares and occupations of our life we may not forget you, but may remember that we are ever walking in your sight; through Jesus Christ our Lord.\\
\textbf{Amen.}\\
\subsubsection*{A Prayer for Mission}
O God, you have made of one blood all the peoples of the earth, and sent your blessed Son to preach peace to those who are far off and to those who are near: Grant that people everywhere may seek after you and find you; bring the nations into your fold; pour out your Spirit upon all flesh; and hasten the coming of your kingdom; through Jesus Christ our Lord.\\
\textbf{Amen.}\\

We ought at all times humbly to acknowledge our sins before Almighty God, but especially when we come together in his presence to give thanks for the great benefits we have received at his hands, to declare his most worthy praise, to hear his holy Word, and to ask, for ourselves and on behalf of others, those things which are necessary for our life and our salvation. {\setlength{\leftskip}{2em}\setlength{\parindent}{0em}\textbf{Spare all those who confess their faults.}}\\

\subsection*{First Reading}

\subsubsection*{The First Lesson}
\centerline{\textit{Judith 8}}
A reading from the Book of Judith, beginning with the eighth chapter, the first verse\\

\begin{quote}
\textsuperscript{8} Now in those days Judith heard about these things: she was the daughter of Merari son of Ox son of Joseph son of Oziel son of Elkiah son of Ananias son of Gideon son of Raphain son of Ahitub son of Elijah son of Hilkiah son of Eliab son of Nathanael son of Salamiel son of Sarasadai son of Israel. \textsuperscript{2} Her husband Manasseh, who belonged to her tribe and family, had died during the barley harvest. \textsuperscript{3} For as he stood overseeing those who were binding sheaves in the field, he was overcome by the burning heat, and took to his bed and died in his town Bethulia. So they buried him with his ancestors in the field between Dothan and Balamon. \textsuperscript{4} Judith remained as a widow for three years and four months \textsuperscript{5} at home where she set up a tent for herself on the roof of her house. She put sackcloth around her waist and dressed in widow’s clothing. \textsuperscript{6} She fasted all the days of her widowhood, except the day before the sabbath and the sabbath itself, the day before the new moon and the day of the new moon, and the festivals and days of rejoicing of the house of Israel. \textsuperscript{7} She was beautiful in appearance, and was very lovely to behold. Her husband Manasseh had left her gold and silver, men and women slaves, livestock, and fields; and she maintained this estate. \textsuperscript{8} No one spoke ill of her, for she feared God with great devotion. \textsuperscript{9} When Judith heard the harsh words spoken by the people against the ruler, because they were faint for lack of water, and when she heard all that Uzziah said to them, and how he promised them under oath to surrender the town to the Assyrians after five days, \textsuperscript{10} she sent her maid, who was in charge of all she possessed, to summon Uzziah and Chabris and Charmis, the elders of her town. \textsuperscript{11} They came to her, and she said to them: “Listen to me, rulers of the people of Bethulia! What you have said to the people today is not right; you have even sworn and pronounced this oath between God and you, promising to surrender the town to our enemies unless the Lord turns and helps us within so many days. \textsuperscript{12} Who are you to put God to the test today, and to set yourselves up in the place of God in human affairs? \textsuperscript{13} You are putting the Lord Almighty to the test, but you will never learn anything! \textsuperscript{14} You cannot plumb the depths of the human heart or understand the workings of the human mind; how do you expect to search out God, who made all these things, and find out his mind or comprehend his thought? No, my brothers, do not anger the Lord our God. \textsuperscript{15} For if he does not choose to help us within these five days, he has power to protect us within any time he pleases, or even to destroy us in the presence of our enemies. \textsuperscript{16} Do not try to bind the purposes of the Lord our God; for God is not like a human being, to be threatened, or like a mere mortal, to be won over by pleading. \textsuperscript{17} Therefore, while we wait for his deliverance, let us call upon him to help us, and he will hear our voice, if it pleases him. \textsuperscript{18} “For never in our generation, nor in these present days, has there been any tribe or family or people or town of ours that worships gods made with hands, as was done in days gone by. \textsuperscript{19} That was why our ancestors were handed over to the sword and to pillage, and so they suffered a great catastrophe before our enemies. \textsuperscript{20} But we know no other god but him, and so we hope that he will not disdain us or any of our nation. \textsuperscript{21} For if we are captured, all Judea will be captured and our sanctuary will be plundered; and he will make us pay for its desecration with our blood. \textsuperscript{22} The slaughter of our kindred and the captivity of the land and the desolation of our inheritance—all this he will bring on our heads among the Gentiles, wherever we serve as slaves; and we shall be an offense and a disgrace in the eyes of those who acquire us. \textsuperscript{23} For our slavery will not bring us into favor, but the Lord our God will turn it to dishonor. \textsuperscript{24} “Therefore, my brothers, let us set an example for our kindred, for their lives depend upon us, and the sanctuary—both the temple and the altar—rests upon us. \textsuperscript{25} In spite of everything let us give thanks to the Lord our God, who is putting us to the test as he did our ancestors. \textsuperscript{26} Remember what he did with Abraham, and how he tested Isaac, and what happened to Jacob in Syrian Mesopotamia, while he was tending the sheep of Laban, his mother’s brother. \textsuperscript{27} For he has not tried us with fire, as he did them, to search their hearts, nor has he taken vengeance on us; but the Lord scourges those who are close to him in order to admonish them. ” \textsuperscript{28} Then Uzziah said to her, “All that you have said was spoken out of a true heart, and there is no one who can deny your words. \textsuperscript{29} Today is not the first time your wisdom has been shown, but from the beginning of your life all the people have recognized your understanding, for your heart’s disposition is right. \textsuperscript{30} But the people were so thirsty that they compelled us to do for them what we have promised, and made us take an oath that we cannot break. \textsuperscript{31} Now since you are a God-fearing woman, pray for us, so that the Lord may send us rain to fill our cisterns. Then we will no longer feel faint from thirst. ” \textsuperscript{32} Then Judith said to them, “Listen to me. I am about to do something that will go down through all generations of our descendants. \textsuperscript{33} Stand at the town gate tonight so that I may go out with my maid; and within the days after which you have promised to surrender the town to our enemies, the Lord will deliver Israel by my hand. \textsuperscript{34} Only, do not try to find out what I am doing; for I will not tell you until I have finished what I am about to do. ” \textsuperscript{35} Uzziah and the rulers said to her, “Go in peace, and may the Lord God go before you, to take vengeance on our enemies. ” \textsuperscript{36} So they returned from the tent and went to their posts.
\end{quote}

If you keep yourselves from these, you will do well. Farewell. ” \textsuperscript{30} So when they were sent off, they went down to Antioch, and having gathered the congregation together, they delivered the letter. \textsuperscript{31} And when they had read it, they rejoiced because of its encouragement. \textsuperscript{32} And Judas and Silas, who were themselves prophets, encouraged and strengthened the brothers with many words. \textsuperscript{33} And after they had spent some time, they were sent off in peace by the brothers to those who had sent them. \textsuperscript{35} But Paul and Barnabas remained in Antioch, teaching and preaching the word of the Lord, with many others also.
\end{quote}

\subsection*{Collect(s) of the Day}

\subsubsection*{Collect of the Day}
\centerline{\textit{Friday after the Twenty-second Sunday after Pentecost, or the Twenty-first Sunday after Trinity (Proper 27)}}
O God, whose blessed Son came into the world that he might destroy the works of the devil and make us children of God and heirs of eternal life: Grant that, having this hope, we may purify ourselves as he is pure; that, when he comes again with power and great glory, we may be made like him in his eternal and glorious kingdom; where he lives and reigns with you and the Holy Spirit, one God, for ever and ever.\\
\textbf{Amen.}\\
\subsubsection*{Collect of the Day}
\centerline{\textit{Consecration of Samuel Seabury, First Bishop in North America, 1784}}
O God, our heavenly Father, you raised up your faithful servant Samuel Seabury to be Bishop and pastor in your Church and to feed your flock: Give abundantly to all pastors the gifts of your Holy Spirit, that they may minister in your household as true servants of Christ and stewards of your divine mysteries; through Jesus Christ our Lord, who lives and reigns with you and the Holy Spirit, one God, for ever and ever.\\
\textbf{Amen.}\\

\subsection*{Additional Collects}

\subsubsection*{A Collect for Endurance}
\centerline{\textit{Friday}}
Almighty God, whose most dear Son went not up to joy but first he suffered pain, and entered not into glory before he was crucified: Mercifully grant that we, walking in the way of the Cross, may find it none other than the way of life and peace; through Jesus Christ your Son our Lord.\\
\textbf{Amen.}\\
\subsubsection*{A Prayer for Mission}
Almighty and everlasting God, who alone works great marvels: Send down upon our clergy and the congregations committed to their charge the life-giving Spirit of your grace, shower them with the continual dew of your blessing, and ignite in them a zealous love of your Gospel; through Jesus Christ our Lord.\\
\textbf{Amen.}\\

A reading from the Book of Judith, beginning with the ninth chapter, the first verse\\

\begin{quote}
\textsuperscript{9} Then Judith prostrated herself, put ashes on her head, and uncovered the sackcloth she was wearing. At the very time when the evening incense was being offered in the house of God in Jerusalem, Judith cried out to the Lord with a loud voice, and said, \textsuperscript{2} “O Lord God of my ancestor Simeon, to whom you gave a sword to take revenge on those strangers who had torn off a virgin’s clothing to defile her, and exposed her thighs to put her to shame, and polluted her womb to disgrace her; for you said, ‘It shall not be done’—yet they did it; \textsuperscript{3} so you gave up their rulers to be killed, and their bed, which was ashamed of the deceit they had practiced, was stained with blood, and you struck down slaves along with princes, and princes on their thrones. \textsuperscript{4} You gave up their wives for booty and their daughters to captivity, and all their booty to be divided among your beloved children who burned with zeal for you and abhorred the pollution of their blood and called on you for help. O God, my God, hear me also, a widow. \textsuperscript{5} “For you have done these things and those that went before and those that followed. You have designed the things that are now, and those that are to come. What you had in mind has happened; \textsuperscript{6} the things you decided on presented themselves and said, ‘Here we are! ’ For all your ways are prepared in advance, and your judgment is with foreknowledge. \textsuperscript{7} “Here now are the Assyrians, a greatly increased force, priding themselves in their horses and riders, boasting in the strength of their foot soldiers, and trusting in shield and spear, in bow and sling. They do not know that you are the Lord who crushes wars; the Lord is your name. \textsuperscript{8} Break their strength by your might, and bring down their power in your anger; for they intend to defile your sanctuary, and to pollute the tabernacle where your glorious name resides, and to break off the horns of your altar with the sword. \textsuperscript{9} Look at their pride, and send your wrath upon their heads. Give to me, a widow, the strong hand to do what I plan. \textsuperscript{10} By the deceit of my lips strike down the slave with the prince and the prince with his servant; crush their arrogance by the hand of a woman. \textsuperscript{11} “For your strength does not depend on numbers, nor your might on the powerful. But you are the God of the lowly, helper of the oppressed, upholder of the weak, protector of the forsaken, savior of those without hope. \textsuperscript{12} Please, please, God of my father, God of the heritage of Israel, Lord of heaven and earth, Creator of the waters, King of all your creation, hear my prayer! \textsuperscript{13} Make my deceitful words bring wound and bruise on those who have planned cruel things against your covenant, and against your sacred house, and against Mount Zion, and against the house your children possess. \textsuperscript{14} Let your whole nation and every tribe know and understand that you are God, the God of all power and might, and that there is no other who protects the people of Israel but you alone! ”
\end{quote}

Here ends the Reading.\\

\subsection*{Collect(s) of the Day}

\subsubsection*{Collect of the Day}
\centerline{\textit{Saturday after the Twenty-second Sunday after Pentecost, or the Twenty-first Sunday after Trinity (Proper 27)}}
O God, whose blessed Son came into the world that he might destroy the works of the devil and make us children of God and heirs of eternal life: Grant that, having this hope, we may purify ourselves as he is pure; that, when he comes again with power and great glory, we may be made like him in his eternal and glorious kingdom; where he lives and reigns with you and the Holy Spirit, one God, for ever and ever.\\
\textbf{Amen.}\\

\subsection*{Additional Collects}

\subsubsection*{A Collect for Sabbath Rest}
\centerline{\textit{Saturday}}
Almighty God, who after the creation of the world rested from all your works and sanctified a day of rest for all your creatures: Grant that we, putting away all earthly anxieties, may be duly prepared for the service of your sanctuary, and that our rest here upon earth may be a preparation for the eternal rest promised to your people in heaven; through Jesus Christ our Lord.\\
\textbf{Amen.}\\
\subsubsection*{A Prayer for Mission}
Lord Jesus Christ, you stretched out your arms of love on the hard wood of the Cross that everyone might come within the reach of your saving embrace: So clothe us in your Spirit that we, reaching forth our hands in love, may bring those who do not know you to the knowledge and love of you; for the honor of your Name.\\
\textbf{Amen.}\\

\centerline{\textit{Judith 10}}
A reading from the Book of Judith, beginning with the tenth chapter, the first verse\\

\begin{quote}
\textsuperscript{10} When Judith had stopped crying out to the God of Israel, and had ended all these words, \textsuperscript{2} she rose from where she lay prostrate. She called her maid and went down into the house where she lived on sabbaths and on her festal days. \textsuperscript{3} She removed the sackcloth she had been wearing, took off her widow’s garments, bathed her body with water, and anointed herself with precious ointment. She combed her hair, put on a tiara, and dressed herself in the festive attire that she used to wear while her husband Manasseh was living. \textsuperscript{4} She put sandals on her feet, and put on her anklets, bracelets, rings, earrings, and all her other jewelry. Thus she made herself very beautiful, to entice the eyes of all the men who might see her. \textsuperscript{5} She gave her maid a skin of wine and a flask of oil, and filled a bag with roasted grain, dried fig cakes, and fine bread; then she wrapped up all her dishes and gave them to her to carry. \textsuperscript{6} Then they went out to the town gate of Bethulia and found Uzziah standing there with the elders of the town, Chabris and Charmis. \textsuperscript{7} When they saw her transformed in appearance and dressed differently, they were very greatly astounded at her beauty and said to her, \textsuperscript{8} “May the God of our ancestors grant you favor and fulfill your plans, so that the people of Israel may glory and Jerusalem may be exalted. ” She bowed down to God. \textsuperscript{9} Then she said to them, “Order the gate of the town to be opened for me so that I may go out and accomplish the things you have just said to me. ” So they ordered the young men to open the gate for her, as she requested. \textsuperscript{10} When they had done this, Judith went out, accompanied by her maid. The men of the town watched her until she had gone down the mountain and passed through the valley, where they lost sight of her. \textsuperscript{11} As the women were going straight on through the valley, an Assyrian patrol met her \textsuperscript{12} and took her into custody. They asked her, “To what people do you belong, and where are you coming from, and where are you going? ” She replied, “I am a daughter of the Hebrews, but I am fleeing from them, for they are about to be handed over to you to be devoured. \textsuperscript{13} I am on my way to see Holofernes the commander of your army, to give him a true report; I will show him a way by which he can go and capture all the hill country without losing one of his men, captured or slain. ” \textsuperscript{14} When the men heard her words, and observed her face—she was in their eyes marvelously beautiful—they said to her, \textsuperscript{15} “You have saved your life by hurrying down to see our lord. Go at once to his tent; some of us will escort you and hand you over to him. \textsuperscript{16} When you stand before him, have no fear in your heart, but tell him what you have just said, and he will treat you well. ” \textsuperscript{17} They chose from their number a hundred men to accompany her and her maid, and they brought them to the tent of Holofernes. \textsuperscript{18} There was great excitement in the whole camp, for her arrival was reported from tent to tent. They came and gathered around her as she stood outside the tent of Holofernes, waiting until they told him about her. \textsuperscript{19} They marveled at her beauty and admired the Israelites, judging them by her. They said to one another, “Who can despise these people, who have women like this among them? It is not wise to leave one of their men alive, for if we let them go they will be able to beguile the whole world! ” \textsuperscript{20} Then the guards of Holofernes and all his servants came out and led her into the tent. \textsuperscript{21} Holofernes was resting on his bed under a canopy that was woven with purple and gold, emeralds and other precious stones. \textsuperscript{22} When they told him of her, he came to the front of the tent, with silver lamps carried before him. \textsuperscript{23} When Judith came into the presence of Holofernes and his servants, they all marveled at the beauty of her face. She prostrated herself and did obeisance to him, but his slaves raised her up.
\end{quote}

\begin{quote}
\textsuperscript{6} And they went through the region of Phrygia and Galatia, having been forbidden by the Holy Spirit to speak the word in Asia. \textsuperscript{7} And when they had come up to Mysia, they attempted to go into Bithynia, but the Spirit of Jesus did not allow them. \textsuperscript{8} So, passing by Mysia, they went down to Troas. \textsuperscript{9} And a vision appeared to Paul in the night: a man of Macedonia was standing there, urging him and saying, “Come over to Macedonia and help us. ” \textsuperscript{10} And when Paul had seen the vision, immediately we sought to go on into Macedonia, concluding that God had called us to preach the gospel to them. \textsuperscript{11} So, setting sail from Troas, we made a direct voyage to Samothrace, and the following day to Neapolis, \textsuperscript{12} and from there to Philippi, which is a leading city of the district of Macedonia and a Roman colony. We remained in this city some days. \textsuperscript{13} And on the Sabbath day we went outside the gate to the riverside, where we supposed there was a place of prayer, and we sat down and spoke to the women who had come together. \textsuperscript{14} One who heard us was a woman named Lydia, from the city of Thyatira, a seller of purple goods, who was a worshiper of God. The Lord opened her heart to pay attention to what was said by Paul. \textsuperscript{15} And after she was baptized, and her household as well, she urged us, saying, “If you have judged me to be faithful to the Lord, come to my house and stay. ” And she prevailed upon us. \textsuperscript{16} As we were going to the place of prayer, we were met by a slave girl who had a spirit of divination and brought her owners much gain by fortune-telling. \textsuperscript{17} She followed Paul and us, crying out, “These men are servants of the Most High God, who proclaim to you the way of salvation. ” \textsuperscript{18} And this she kept doing for many days. Paul, having become greatly annoyed, turned and said to the spirit, “I command you in the name of Jesus Christ to come out of her. ” And it came out that very hour. \textsuperscript{19} But when her owners saw that their hope of gain was gone, they seized Paul and Silas and dragged them into the marketplace before the rulers. \textsuperscript{20} And when they had brought them to the magistrates, they said, “These men are Jews, and they are disturbing our city. \textsuperscript{21} They advocate customs that are not lawful for us as Romans to accept or practice. ” \textsuperscript{22} The crowd joined in attacking them, and the magistrates tore the garments off them and gave orders to beat them with rods. \textsuperscript{23} And when they had inflicted many blows upon them, they threw them into prison, ordering the jailer to keep them safely. \textsuperscript{24} Having received this order, he put them into the inner prison and fastened their feet in the stocks. \textsuperscript{25} About midnight Paul and Silas were praying and singing hymns to God, and the prisoners were listening to them, \textsuperscript{26} and suddenly there was a great earthquake, so that the foundations of the prison were shaken. And immediately all the doors were opened, and everyone's bonds were unfastened. \textsuperscript{27} When the jailer woke and saw that the prison doors were open, he drew his sword and was about to kill himself, supposing that the prisoners had escaped. \textsuperscript{28} But Paul cried with a loud voice, “Do not harm yourself, for we are all here. ” \textsuperscript{29} And the jailer called for lights and rushed in, and trembling with fear he fell down before Paul and Silas. \textsuperscript{30} Then he brought them out and said, “Sirs, what must I do to be saved? ” \textsuperscript{31} And they said, “Believe in the Lord Jesus, and you will be saved, you and your household. ” \textsuperscript{32} And they spoke the word of the Lord to him and to all who were in his house. \textsuperscript{33} And he took them the same hour of the night and washed their wounds; and he was baptized at once, he and all his family. \textsuperscript{34} Then he brought them up into his house and set food before them. And he rejoiced along with his entire household that he had believed in God. \textsuperscript{35} But when it was day, the magistrates sent the police, saying, “Let those men go. ” \textsuperscript{36} And the jailer reported these words to Paul, saying, “The magistrates have sent to let you go. Therefore come out now and go in peace. ” \textsuperscript{37} But Paul said to them, “They have beaten us publicly, uncondemned, men who are Roman citizens, and have thrown us into prison; and do they now throw us out secretly? No! Let them come themselves and take us out. ” \textsuperscript{38} The police reported these words to the magistrates, and they were afraid when they heard that they were Roman citizens. \textsuperscript{39} So they came and apologized to them. And they took them out and asked them to leave the city. \textsuperscript{40} So they went out of the prison and visited Lydia. And when they had seen the brothers, they encouraged them and departed.

\subsection*{Collect(s) of the Day}

\subsubsection*{Collect of the Day}
\centerline{\textit{The Twenty-third Sunday after Pentecost, or the Twenty-second Sunday after Trinity (Proper 28)}}
Stir up, O Lord, the wills of your faithful people, that bringing forth in abundance the fruit of good works, they may be abundantly rewarded when our Savior Jesus Christ comes to restore all things; who lives and reigns with you and the Holy Spirit, one God, for ever and ever.\\
\textbf{Amen.}\\
\subsubsection*{Collect of the Day}
\centerline{\textit{Margaret, Queen of Scotland, Reformer of the Church and Renewer of Society, 1093}}
O God, by your grace your servant Margaret, kindled by the flame of your love, became a burning and shining light in your Church, turning pride into humility and error into truth: Grant that we may be set aflame with the same spirit of love and discipline, and walk before you as children of light; through Jesus Christ our Lord, who lives and reigns with you, in the unity of the Holy Spirit, one God, now and for ever.\\
\textbf{Amen.}\\

\subsection*{Additional Collects}

\subsubsection*{A Collect for Strength to Await Christ's Return}
\centerline{\textit{Sunday}}
O God our King, by the resurrection of your Son Jesus Christ on the first day of the week, you conquered sin, put death to flight, and gave us the hope of everlasting life: Redeem all our days by this victory; forgive our sins, banish our fears, make us bold to praise you and to do your will; and steel us to wait for the consummation of your kingdom on the last great Day; through Jesus Christ our Lord.\\
\textbf{Amen.}\\
\subsubsection*{A Prayer for Mission}
O God, you have made of one blood all the peoples of the earth, and sent your blessed Son to preach peace to those who are far off and to those who are near: Grant that people everywhere may seek after you and find you; bring the nations into your fold; pour out your Spirit upon all flesh; and hasten the coming of your kingdom; through Jesus Christ our Lord.\\
\textbf{Amen.}\\

\centerline{\textit{Judith 11}}
A reading from the Book of Judith, beginning with the eleventh chapter, the first verse\\

\begin{quote}
\textsuperscript{11} Then Holofernes said to her, “Take courage, woman, and do not be afraid in your heart, for I have never hurt anyone who chose to serve Nebuchadnezzar, king of all the earth. \textsuperscript{2} Even now, if your people who live in the hill country had not slighted me, I would never have lifted my spear against them. They have brought this on themselves. \textsuperscript{3} But now tell me why you have fled from them and have come over to us. In any event, you have come to safety. Take courage! You will live tonight and ever after. \textsuperscript{4} No one will hurt you. Rather, all will treat you well, as they do the servants of my lord King Nebuchadnezzar. ” \textsuperscript{5} Judith answered him, “Accept the words of your slave, and let your servant speak in your presence. I will say nothing false to my lord this night. \textsuperscript{6} If you follow out the words of your servant, God will accomplish something through you, and my lord will not fail to achieve his purposes. \textsuperscript{7} By the life of Nebuchadnezzar, king of the whole earth, and by the power of him who has sent you to direct every living being! Not only do human beings serve him because of you, but also the animals of the field and the cattle and the birds of the air will live, because of your power, under Nebuchadnezzar and all his house. \textsuperscript{8} For we have heard of your wisdom and skill, and it is reported throughout the whole world that you alone are the best in the whole kingdom, the most informed and the most astounding in military strategy. \textsuperscript{9} “Now as for Achior’s speech in your council, we have heard his words, for the people of Bethulia spared him and he told them all he had said to you. \textsuperscript{10} Therefore, lord and master, do not disregard what he said, but keep it in your mind, for it is true. Indeed our nation cannot be punished, nor can the sword prevail against them, unless they sin against their God. \textsuperscript{11} “But now, in order that my lord may not be defeated and his purpose frustrated, death will fall upon them, for a sin has overtaken them by which they are about to provoke their God to anger when they do what is wrong. \textsuperscript{12} Since their food supply is exhausted and their water has almost given out, they have planned to kill their livestock and have determined to use all that God by his laws has forbidden them to eat. \textsuperscript{13} They have decided to consume the first fruits of the grain and the tithes of the wine and oil, which they had consecrated and set aside for the priests who minister in the presence of our God in Jerusalem—things it is not lawful for any of the people even to touch with their hands. \textsuperscript{14} Since even the people in Jerusalem have been doing this, they have sent messengers there in order to bring back permission from the council of the elders. \textsuperscript{15} When the response reaches them and they act upon it, on that very day they will be handed over to you to be destroyed. \textsuperscript{16} “So when I, your slave, learned all this, I fled from them. God has sent me to accomplish with you things that will astonish the whole world wherever people shall hear about them. \textsuperscript{17} Your servant is indeed God-fearing and serves the God of heaven night and day. So, my lord, I will remain with you; but every night your servant will go out into the valley and pray to God. He will tell me when they have committed their sins. \textsuperscript{18} Then I will come and tell you, so that you may go out with your whole army, and not one of them will be able to withstand you. \textsuperscript{19} Then I will lead you through Judea, until you come to Jerusalem; there I will set your throne. You will drive them like sheep that have no shepherd, and no dog will so much as growl at you. For this was told me to give me foreknowledge; it was announced to me, and I was sent to tell you. ” \textsuperscript{20} Her words pleased Holofernes and all his servants. They marveled at her wisdom and said, \textsuperscript{21} “No other woman from one end of the earth to the other looks so beautiful or speaks so wisely! ” \textsuperscript{22} Then Holofernes said to her, “God has done well to send you ahead of the people, to strengthen our hands and bring destruction on those who have despised my lord. \textsuperscript{23} You are not only beautiful in appearance, but wise in speech. If you do as you have said, your God shall be my God, and you shall live in the palace of King Nebuchadnezzar and be renowned throughout the whole world. ”
\end{quote}

\begin{quote}
\textsuperscript{17} Now when they had passed through Amphipolis and Apollonia, they came to Thessalonica, where there was a synagogue of the Jews. \textsuperscript{2} And Paul went in, as was his custom, and on three Sabbath days he reasoned with them from the Scriptures, \textsuperscript{3} explaining and proving that it was necessary for the Christ to suffer and to rise from the dead, and saying, “This Jesus, whom I proclaim to you, is the Christ. ” \textsuperscript{4} And some of them were persuaded and joined Paul and Silas, as did a great many of the devout Greeks and not a few of the leading women. \textsuperscript{5} But the Jews were jealous, and taking some wicked men of the rabble, they formed a mob, set the city in an uproar, and attacked the house of Jason, seeking to bring them out to the crowd. \textsuperscript{6} And when they could not find them, they dragged Jason and some of the brothers before the city authorities, shouting, “These men who have turned the world upside down have come here also, \textsuperscript{7} and Jason has received them, and they are all acting against the decrees of Caesar, saying that there is another king, Jesus. ” \textsuperscript{8} And the people and the city authorities were disturbed when they heard these things. \textsuperscript{9} And when they had taken money as security from Jason and the rest, they let them go. \textsuperscript{10} The brothers immediately sent Paul and Silas away by night to Berea, and when they arrived they went into the Jewish synagogue. \textsuperscript{11} Now these Jews were more noble than those in Thessalonica; they received the word with all eagerness, examining the Scriptures daily to see if these things were so. \textsuperscript{12} Many of them therefore believed, with not a few Greek women of high standing as well as men. \textsuperscript{13} But when the Jews from Thessalonica learned that the word of God was proclaimed by Paul at Berea also, they came there too, agitating and stirring up the crowds. \textsuperscript{14} Then the brothers immediately sent Paul off on his way to the sea, but Silas and Timothy remained there. \textsuperscript{15} Those who conducted Paul brought him as far as Athens, and after receiving a command for Silas and Timothy to come to him as soon as possible, they departed.
\end{quote}

The Word of the Lord.\\
\textbf{Thanks be to God.}\\

\subsection*{Collect(s) of the Day}

\subsubsection*{Collect of the Day}
\centerline{\textit{Monday after the Twenty-third Sunday after Pentecost, or the Twenty-second Sunday after Trinity (Proper 28)}}
Stir up, O Lord, the wills of your faithful people, that bringing forth in abundance the fruit of good works, they may be abundantly rewarded when our Savior Jesus Christ comes to restore all things; who lives and reigns with you and the Holy Spirit, one God, for ever and ever.\\
\textbf{Amen.}\\
\subsubsection*{Collect of the Day}
\centerline{\textit{Hugh, Bishop of Lincoln and Renewer of Society, 1200}}
O God, our heavenly Father, you raised up your faithful servant Hugh of Lincoln to be Bishop and pastor in your Church and to feed your flock: Give abundantly to all pastors the gifts of your Holy Spirit, that they may minister in your household as true servants of Christ and stewards of your divine mysteries; through Jesus Christ our Lord, who lives and reigns with you and the Holy Spirit, one God, for ever and ever.\\
\textbf{Amen.}\\

\subsection*{Additional Collects}

\subsubsection*{A Collect for the Renewal of Life}
\centerline{\textit{Monday}}
O God, the King eternal, whose light divides the day from the night and turns the shadow of death into the morning: Drive far from us all wrong desires, incline our hearts to keep your law, and guide our feet into the way of peace; that, having done your will with cheerfulness during the day, we may, when night comes, rejoice to give you thanks; through Jesus Christ our Lord.\\
\textbf{Amen.}\\
\subsubsection*{A Prayer for Mission}
Almighty and everlasting God, who alone works great marvels: Send down upon our clergy and the congregations committed to their charge the life-giving Spirit of your grace, shower them with the continual dew of your blessing, and ignite in them a zealous love of your Gospel; through Jesus Christ our Lord.\\
\textbf{Amen.}\\

\begin{quote}
\textsuperscript{12} Then he commanded them to bring her in where his silver dinnerware was kept, and ordered them to set a table for her with some of his own delicacies, and with some of his own wine to drink. \textsuperscript{2} But Judith said, “I cannot partake of them, or it will be an offense; but I will have enough with the things I brought with me. ” \textsuperscript{3} Holofernes said to her, “If your supply runs out, where can we get you more of the same? For none of your people are here with us. ” \textsuperscript{4} Judith replied, “As surely as you live, my lord, your servant will not use up the supplies I have with me before the Lord carries out by my hand what he has determined. ” \textsuperscript{5} Then the servants of Holofernes brought her into the tent, and she slept until midnight. Toward the morning watch she got up \textsuperscript{6} and sent this message to Holofernes: “Let my lord now give orders to allow your servant to go out and pray. ” \textsuperscript{7} So Holofernes commanded his guards not to hinder her. She remained in the camp three days. She went out each night to the valley of Bethulia, and bathed at the spring in the camp. \textsuperscript{8} After bathing, she prayed the Lord God of Israel to direct her way for the triumph of his people. \textsuperscript{9} Then she returned purified and stayed in the tent until she ate her food toward evening. \textsuperscript{10} On the fourth day Holofernes held a banquet for his personal attendants only, and did not invite any of his officers. \textsuperscript{11} He said to Bagoas, the eunuch who had charge of his personal affairs, “Go and persuade the Hebrew woman who is in your care to join us and to eat and drink with us. \textsuperscript{12} For it would be a disgrace if we let such a woman go without having intercourse with her. If we do not seduce her, she will laugh at us. ” \textsuperscript{13} So Bagoas left the presence of Holofernes, and approached her and said, “Let this pretty girl not hesitate to come to my lord to be honored in his presence, and to enjoy drinking wine with us, and to become today like one of the Assyrian women who serve in the palace of Nebuchadnezzar. ” \textsuperscript{14} Judith replied, “Who am I to refuse my lord? Whatever pleases him I will do at once, and it will be a joy to me until the day of my death. ” \textsuperscript{15} So she proceeded to dress herself in all her woman’s finery. Her maid went ahead and spread for her on the ground before Holofernes the lambskins she had received from Bagoas for her daily use in reclining. \textsuperscript{16} Then Judith came in and lay down. Holofernes’ heart was ravished with her and his passion was aroused, for he had been waiting for an opportunity to seduce her from the day he first saw her. \textsuperscript{17} So Holofernes said to her, “Have a drink and be merry with us! ” \textsuperscript{18} Judith said, “I will gladly drink, my lord, because today is the greatest day in my whole life. ” \textsuperscript{19} Then she took what her maid had prepared and ate and drank before him. \textsuperscript{20} Holofernes was greatly pleased with her, and drank a great quantity of wine, much more than he had ever drunk in any one day since he was born.
\end{quote}

\subsection*{Collect(s) of the Day}

\subsubsection*{Collect of the Day}
\centerline{\textit{Tuesday after the Twenty-third Sunday after Pentecost, or the Twenty-second Sunday after Trinity (Proper 28)}}
Stir up, O Lord, the wills of your faithful people, that bringing forth in abundance the fruit of good works, they may be abundantly rewarded when our Savior Jesus Christ comes to restore all things; who lives and reigns with you and the Holy Spirit, one God, for ever and ever.\\
\textbf{Amen.}\\
\subsubsection*{Collect of the Day}
\centerline{\textit{Elizabeth of Hungary, Renewer of Society, 1231}}
Almighty and everlasting God, you kindled the flame of your love in the heart of your servant Elizabeth of Hungary to manifest your compassion and mercy to the poor and the persecuted: Grant to us, your humble servants, a like faith and power of love, that we who give thanks for her righteous zeal may profit by her example; through Jesus Christ our Lord, who lives and reigns with you and the Holy Spirit, one God, for ever and ever.\\
\textbf{Amen.}\\

\subsection*{Additional Collects}

\subsubsection*{A Collect for Peace}
\centerline{\textit{Tuesday}}
O God, the author of peace and lover of concord, to know you is eternal life and to serve you is perfect freedom: Defend us, your humble servants, in all assaults of our enemies; that we, surely trusting in your defense, may not fear the power of any adversaries, through the might of Jesus Christ our Lord.\\
\textbf{Amen.}\\
\subsubsection*{A Prayer for Mission}
Lord Jesus Christ, you stretched out your arms of love on the hard wood of the Cross that everyone might come within the reach of your saving embrace: So clothe us in your Spirit that we, reaching forth our hands in love, may bring those who do not know you to the knowledge and love of you; for the honor of your Name.\\
\textbf{Amen.}\\

A reading from the Book of Judith, beginning with the thirteenth chapter, the first verse\\

\begin{quote}
\textsuperscript{13} When evening came, his slaves quickly withdrew. Bagoas closed the tent from outside and shut out the attendants from his master’s presence. They went to bed, for they all were weary because the banquet had lasted so long. \textsuperscript{2} But Judith was left alone in the tent, with Holofernes stretched out on his bed, for he was dead drunk. \textsuperscript{3} Now Judith had told her maid to stand outside the bedchamber and to wait for her to come out, as she did on the other days; for she said she would be going out for her prayers. She had said the same thing to Bagoas. \textsuperscript{4} So everyone went out, and no one, either small or great, was left in the bedchamber. Then Judith, standing beside his bed, said in her heart, “O Lord God of all might, look in this hour on the work of my hands for the exaltation of Jerusalem. \textsuperscript{5} Now indeed is the time to help your heritage and to carry out my design to destroy the enemies who have risen up against us. ” \textsuperscript{6} She went up to the bedpost near Holofernes’ head, and took down his sword that hung there. \textsuperscript{7} She came close to his bed, took hold of the hair of his head, and said, “Give me strength today, O Lord God of Israel! ” \textsuperscript{8} Then she struck his neck twice with all her might, and cut off his head. \textsuperscript{9} Next she rolled his body off the bed and pulled down the canopy from the posts. Soon afterward she went out and gave Holofernes’ head to her maid, \textsuperscript{10} who placed it in her food bag. Then the two of them went out together, as they were accustomed to do for prayer. They passed through the camp, circled around the valley, and went up the mountain to Bethulia, and came to its gates. \textsuperscript{11} From a distance Judith called out to the sentries at the gates, “Open, open the gate! God, our God, is with us, still showing his power in Israel and his strength against our enemies, as he has done today! ” \textsuperscript{12} When the people of her town heard her voice, they hurried down to the town gate and summoned the elders of the town. \textsuperscript{13} They all ran together, both small and great, for it seemed unbelievable that she had returned. They opened the gate and welcomed them. Then they lit a fire to give light, and gathered around them. \textsuperscript{14} Then she said to them with a loud voice, “Praise God, O praise him! Praise God, who has not withdrawn his mercy from the house of Israel, but has destroyed our enemies by my hand this very night! ” \textsuperscript{15} Then she pulled the head out of the bag and showed it to them, and said, “See here, the head of Holofernes, the commander of the Assyrian army, and here is the canopy beneath which he lay in his drunken stupor. The Lord has struck him down by the hand of a woman. \textsuperscript{16} As the Lord lives, who has protected me in the way I went, I swear that it was my face that seduced him to his destruction, and that he committed no sin with me, to defile and shame me. ” \textsuperscript{17} All the people were greatly astonished. They bowed down and worshiped God, and said with one accord, “Blessed are you our God, who have this day humiliated the enemies of your people. ” \textsuperscript{18} Then Uzziah said to her, “O daughter, you are blessed by the Most High God above all other women on earth; and blessed be the Lord God, who created the heavens and the earth, who has guided you to cut off the head of the leader of our enemies. \textsuperscript{19} Your praise will never depart from the hearts of those who remember the power of God. \textsuperscript{20} May God grant this to be a perpetual honor to you, and may he reward you with blessings, because you risked your own life when our nation was brought low, and you averted our ruin, walking in the straight path before our God. ” And all the people said, “Amen. Amen. ”
\end{quote}

\subsection*{Collect(s) of the Day}

\subsubsection*{Collect of the Day}
\centerline{\textit{Wednesday after the Twenty-third Sunday after Pentecost, or the Twenty-second Sunday after Trinity (Proper 28)}}
Stir up, O Lord, the wills of your faithful people, that bringing forth in abundance the fruit of good works, they may be abundantly rewarded when our Savior Jesus Christ comes to restore all things; who lives and reigns with you and the Holy Spirit, one God, for ever and ever.\\
\textbf{Amen.}\\
\subsubsection*{Collect of the Day}
\centerline{\textit{Hilda, Abbess of Whitby, 680}}
O God, your blessed Son became poor for our sake, and chose the Cross over the kingdoms of this world: Deliver us from an inordinate love of worldly things, that we, inspired by the devotion of your servant Hilda, may seek you with singleness of heart, behold your glory by faith, and attain to the riches of your everlasting kingdom, where we shall be united with our Savior Jesus Christ; who lives and reigns with you and the Holy Spirit, one God, now and for ever.\\
\textbf{Amen.}\\

\subsection*{Additional Collects}

\subsubsection*{A Collect for Grace}
\centerline{\textit{Wednesday}}
O Lord, our heavenly Father, almighty and everlasting God, you have brought us safely to the beginning of this day: Defend us by your mighty power, that we may not fall into sin nor run into any danger; and that, guided by your Spirit, we may do what is righteous in your sight; through Jesus Christ our Lord.\\
\textbf{Amen.}\\
\subsubsection*{A Prayer for Mission}
O God, you have made of one blood all the peoples of the earth, and sent your blessed Son to preach peace to those who are far off and to those who are near: Grant that people everywhere may seek after you and find you; bring the nations into your fold; pour out your Spirit upon all flesh; and hasten the coming of your kingdom; through Jesus Christ our Lord.\\
\textbf{Amen.}\\
